listen statue
The Statue of Mercy says, "I see you have talked to Thalien."
The Statue of Mercy says, "I had hoped that he would find someone to come
 here."
The Statue of Mercy says, "This was once a peaceful temple devoted to
 improving the lives of its members."
The Statue of Mercy says, "But then Zyian and his followers came along,
 and before long, all of the people here were either killed or converted to
 his cult."
The Statue of Mercy says, "Now they are planning something and it is up to
 you to stop them."
The Statue of Mercy says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
 to me that you have mercy in your heart."
The Statue of Mercy says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel woman is
 torturing some elves."
The Statue of Mercy says, "Release an elf from their pain, and end this
 cruel woman's sadistic ways."
The Statue of Mercy says, "I will know when you have accomplished this,
 but you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to
 complete the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you
 what else we know."

tasks here

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 4  : Mercy Quest - Free the Elves!

The Statue of Mercy says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel woman is 
torturing some elves." 
The Statue of Mercy says, "Release an elf from their pain, and end 
this cruel woman's sadistic ways." 
The Statue of Mercy says,"I will know when you have accomplished this,
but you also will have to complete the tasks that the other statues 
request before we can tell you what else we know." 

Task 5  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 6  : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 7  : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 8  : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 9  : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 10 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
{coords}-1
{rdesc}
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.
{/rdesc}

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
{coords}0,30,20
{rdesc}
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the

boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.

|x=xBOOTx=x| Enlossys: or a self-pub by a teenager


       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 4  : Mercy Quest - Free the Elves!

The Statue of Mercy says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel woman is 
torturing some elves." 
The Statue of Mercy says, "Release an elf from their pain, and end 
this cruel woman's sadistic ways." 
The Statue of Mercy says,"I will know when you have accomplished this,
but you also will have to complete the tasks that the other statues 
request before we can tell you what else we know." 

Task 6  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 7  : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 8  : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 9  : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 10 : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 11 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 8  : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 9  : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 10 : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 11 : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 12 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

walls, strange glyphs are scrawled.  They appear to be freshly made, and

screaming and moaning, but you cannot tell from where.  
{/rdesc}

tasks here

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 8  : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 9  : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 10 : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 11 : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 12 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

{coords}3,12,28
{rdesc}
  The shelves of the library hold many different types of books and are
quite tall, easily reaching a height of two or three stories.  To the west,
the books seem to contain knowledge of battle.  To the south, a book of
spells.  Each side of the library also has a large wooden door, and you
can't help but feel that what is behind the door will rely on the knowledge
learnt from the books that surround it.

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 11 : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 12 : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 13 : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 14 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

Before the Temple
{coords}3,12,28
{rdesc}
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.  
{/rdesc}

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
{coords}-1
{rdesc}
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.
{/rdesc}

<MAPEND>

Medical lounge (G)
{coords}-1
{rdesc}
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.
{/rdesc}

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Small Well... (2128)

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (east) up ]
A centipede is crawling along the floor, looking for its next meal.
You have 10 tells waiting. Type 'replay' to see them.

tasks here

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 11 : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 12 : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 13 : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 14 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

A Smaller Library...
  You find yourself now standing in a much smaller library than you were in 
before. However, it seems that the books here are only on one subject: Magic 
Use. A lone figure sits here reading, and with a minor gesture of his hand, 
another book floats from a shelf and into his hand. He barely takes the time 
to look at you before he continues his work.

Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Small Well... (2092)

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.

Searching the Caverns... [**> PK <**]
  Dank and dark are these caves. You notice that water sheets down the wall in 
some areas of this cave, giving the cavern an almost mirror-like surface. As 
you venture forward, you come across a corpse of a Elf, hacked to bits and 
half eaten by the insects that inhabit the caverns. Perhaps this would be a 
good time to find your way out of here...

A Large Library
  The shelves of the library hold many different types of books and are
quite tall, easily reaching a height of two or three stories.  To the west,
the books seem to contain knowledge of battle.  To the south, a book of
spells.  Each side of the library also has a large wooden door, and you
can't help but feel that what is behind the door will rely on the knowledge
learnt from the books that surround it.

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 12 : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 13 : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 14 : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 15 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

Lv 136  G 493499 | A Large Library (N[S]W)
>>
A Smaller Library...
  You find yourself now standing in a much smaller library than you were in 
before. However, it seems that the books here are only on one subject: Magic 
Use. A lone figure sits here reading, and with a minor gesture of his hand, 
another book floats from a shelf and into his hand. He barely takes the time 
to look at you before he continues his work.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south ]
     (Magic) (Hum) A simple crest lies on the floor here, depicting a large war.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) Nyruk the Black Mage sits here, leafing through a book.
Nyruk the Black Mage exclaims, "You will never get this from me!"

[*Daily Blessing*] 3181/3635 HP  3601/4275 MP  2151/2152 mv  884tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 136  G 493499 | A Smaller Library... (S)
>>
Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) east west ]
(Golden Aura) A swordsman stands here, practicing with his sword.
(Golden Aura) A footsoldier walks along here, trying to stay at attention.
(Golden Aura) A swordsman stands here, practicing with his sword.

Along the Pews (2150)

The Altar of Pleasure (G) (2150)

The Altar of Sacrifice (2150)

A Long Corridor (2150)

A Long Corridor
  The corridor comes to an abrupt halt here.  At the end of the hall there
is a large carving in the wall.  It appears to be a depiction of a daemon,
drinking the blood of the monks who worship in this temple.  As you look at
the carving, you can start to hear a low moaning or chanting coming from
behind a large wooden door to the west.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (west) ]
(Golden Aura) An initiate of Zyian kneels here, praying to him.
(Golden Aura) An initiate of Zyian kneels here, praying to him.
(Golden Aura) An initiate of Zyian kneels here, praying to him.
(Golden Aura) An initiate of Zyian kneels here, praying to him.

>>
The Room of the Blessed
  The room for the blessed is much different from those of the intitates
and of the faithful.  Large beds lie here, books abound, and there are many
tables which hold food, drink, and cards.  Occasionally an initiate comes
in, to serve the blessed, but then leaves on his knees when dismissed.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
     (Magic) Some all-black cloth armor lies on the ground.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A multi-facted red gem lies on the ground.

(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A blessed monk stands here, performing the rites of Zyian.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A blessed monk stands here, performing the rites of Zyian.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2238/3635 HP  3193/4275 MP  2152/2152 mv  780tnl (Reply: Gorsk) 
Lv 136  G 502144 | The Room of the Blessed ([E])
>>

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 13 : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 14 : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 15 : Kill a Golem

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing a golem." 

Task 16 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

A Small Dirt Path
  This once large trail has now been reclaimed by the wild grass that grows
to either side of it.  Only cows keep the trail alive, by walking and
grazing.  The trail leads north to a small farm.

A Small Well... (2092)

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (east) up ]
(White Aura) (Angry) A Trapdoor Spider lies here in wait.
A centipede is crawling along the floor, looking for its next meal.
A centipede is crawling along the floor, looking for its next meal.

Searching the Caverns... [**> PK <**]
  Dank and dark are these caves. You notice that water sheets down the wall in 
some areas of this cave, giving the cavern an almost mirror-like surface. As 
you venture forward, you come across a corpse of a Elf, hacked to bits and 
half eaten by the insects that inhabit the caverns. Perhaps this would be a 
good time to find your way out of here...

A Narrow Tunnel (2078)

Entrance to the Castle
  As you climb out of the tunnel, you see a rather large castle, carved almost 
entirely of the stone that makes up these caverns. There are large stone 
pillars, and fountains that are filled with what appears to be blood.

A Dark Passageway
  The halls of this castle are dimly lit by an unknown source.  Along the
walls, strange glyphs are scrawled.  They appear to be freshly made, and
written in blood.  As you walk along, you can hear a mixture of laughing,
screaming and moaning, but you cannot tell from where.

The Golem Factory
  Parts of bodies lie in a heap here. Some of the body parts are rotting, while
other are merely smashed beyond recognition. A lone man works feverishly on 
what appears to be a golem made entirely out of flesh. As he turns, he looks 
at at you. After giving your body a look, he mumbles, "no no, that won't do".
He then ignores you and goes back to working on his golem.

<MAPEND>

Berun asks, "Hello there! I am low on body parts, so would you like to
 make a 'donation'?"

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 13 : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 14 : Kill Berun

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing Berun, the Golem Maker." 

Task 16 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 13 : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 16 : Kill any 3 body parts
          Body parts to kill: 3

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by 
killing any 3 body parts."

The Golem Factory
  Parts of bodies lie in a heap here. Some of the body parts are rotting, while
other are merely smashed beyond recognition. A lone man works feverishly on 
what appears to be a golem made entirely out of flesh. As he turns, he looks 
at at you. After giving your body a look, he mumbles, "no no, that won't do".

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 6  : Return to the Statue of Mercy

An image of the statue of mercy appears before you and reminds you that you 
still need to return to the statue.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

Task 13 : Fame Quest - Stop the Golem Maker

The Statue of Fame says, "But before we can continue, I need you to prove
to me that you have the courage to be famous."

The Statue of Fame says, "Somewhere in this temple, a cruel man called
Berun is creating golems from the body parts of involuntary donors."

The Statue of Fame says, "Prove that you have the courage to be famous by
killing any 3 body parts, killing a golem, and killing Berun himself."

The Statue of Fame says, "I will know when you have accomplished this, but
you will still need to return to me, and you also will have to complete
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."

fame so you can be recognized for your achievements.

The Golem Factory
  Parts of bodies lie in a heap here. Some of the body parts are rotting, while
other are merely smashed beyond recognition. A lone man works feverishly on 
what appears to be a golem made entirely out of flesh. As he turns, he looks 
at at you. After giving your body a look, he mumbles, "no no, that won't do".
He then ignores you and goes back to working on his golem.

A Dark Passageway (2147)

A Large Library
  The shelves of the library hold many different types of books and are
quite tall, easily reaching a height of two or three stories.  To the west,
the books seem to contain knowledge of battle.  To the south, a book of
spells.  Each side of the library also has a large wooden door, and you
can't help but feel that what is behind the door will rely on the knowledge
learnt from the books that surround it.

Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 3  : Talk to the Statues

Thalien says, "I was trying to pick these flowers for Sarah when these people
came through a door in the well and kidnapped me." 

Thalien says, "Life was dismal after that because they barely fed me and 
even the water was scarce." 

Thalien says, "I did learn that they are part of some kind of cult that 
worships someone called Zyian." 

Thalien says, "Something strange did happen while I was here that I think 
I should tell you about." 

Thalien says, "As I was walking past these statues, I heard a voice whisper 
that I shouldn't lose hope."

 Thalien says, "Maybe you should find them and see what you can find 
out about these cultists." 

The statues talk about how this was once a peaceful temple devoted to 
improving the lives of its members. They also say that a cult leader called 
Zyian move in and either killed or converted the members of the temple. They 
need you to end his evil plans and stop him by any means necessary.

Task 7  : Knowledge Quest - Return the Book

The Statue of Knowledge says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the meaning of knowledge."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Somewhere in this temple, a black mage
called Nyruk has a book of earth magic that he will use to devastate
nearby towns. "

The Statue of Knowledge says, "Stop his evil plans and bring the book to
me."

The Statue of Knowledge says, "You also will have to complete the tasks
that the other statues request before we can tell you what else we know."

Task 9  : Return to the Statue of Knowledge

Task 10 : Wealth Quest - Return the Gem

The Statue of Wealth says, "But before we can continue, I need you to
prove to me that you understand the value of wealth."

The Statue of Wealth says, "Somewhere in this temple, a creature 
called Foulspawn has a gem that was taken from my statue. " 

The Statue of Wealth says, "Show that you understand wealth by 
returning the gem to me." 

The Statue of Wealth says, "You also will have to complete 
the tasks that the other statues request before we can tell you what else
we know."
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

<MAPEND>

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Small Well... (2092)

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.

A Large Library
  The shelves of the library hold many different types of books and are
quite tall, easily reaching a height of two or three stories.  To the west,
the books seem to contain knowledge of battle.  To the south, a book of
spells.  Each side of the library also has a large wooden door, and you
can't help but feel that what is behind the door will rely on the knowledge
learnt from the books that surround it.

Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) east west ]
(Golden Aura) A swordsman stands here, practicing with his sword.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Small Well... (2168)

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.

A Large Library

quite tall, easily reaching a height of two or three stories.  To the west,

learnt from the books that surround it.

Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.

The Lair of the Keeper
  As you enter the room, you can see a rather large statue of some sort of
twisted and mangled creature.  On the wall, you notice that there are words
carved.  Most refer to Fortune, Fame, Love and Pleasure.  Then, as you look
back to the statue, you notice that it is moving, and heading towards you!

The Keeper of Secrets sneers in disgust at you!

 weakling Zyian would stop me??"
The Keeper of Secrets exclaims, "He thought he was this great leader who
 would lead his troops to conquer Abend, when he was really just a
 figurehead to buy time until I could bring forth the demons from the
 portal!"
The Keeper of Secrets asks, "If you are wondering why I keep the people in
 the temple around?"
The Keeper of Secrets says, "Let's just say that even demons need
 entertainment."
The Keeper of Secrets exclaims, "Now leave before you become their first
 victim!"
A large portal starts to form as the Keeper begins making arcane gestures.

>>

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 21 : Stop the Summoning!

As you enter the room, the Demon known as the Keeper of Secrets turns
toward you.

The Keeper of Secrets sneers in disgust at you!

The Keeper of Secrets demands, "Did you actually think that defeating that
weakling Zyian would stop me??"

The Keeper of Secrets exclaims, "He thought he was this great leader who
would lead his troops to conquer Abend, when he was really just a
figurehead to buy time until I could bring forth the demons from the
portal!"

The Keeper of Secrets asks, "If you are wondering why I keep the people
in the temple around?"

The Keeper of Secrets says, "Let's just say that even demons need
entertainment."

The Keeper of Secrets exclaims, "Now leave before you become their first
victim!"
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

back to the statue, you notice that it is moving, and heading towards you!

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.
(Player) (Red Aura) (White Aura) Cnyin the Sorcerer is sleeping on Medical beds.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago is sleeping on Medical
beds.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Translucent) (White Aura) Talbor the Enchanter.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Inix the Hunter is sleeping in a trivia sleeping bag.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

wake
You wake up on Medical beds, then stand up.
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.
(Player) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago is sleeping on Medical beds.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>

An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Open Field
  You are standing in the middle of a vast field.  It would be a
run-of-the-mill field, except for the fact that there's a strange object of
immense size hovering overhead.  The beautiful flying work of art appears to
be a flying ship.  What's even more interesting, is there is a rope ladder
which hangs down from the side of the ship.  It's the perfect invitation for
you to enter.
