climb ladder

------------------------------------------------------------
You clutch the rope ladder tightly and pull yourself into the ship.
------------------------------------------------------------
Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Before the Bow (2191)

In front of The Bowsprit
  The view from the bowsprit is breathtaking.  You can see the horizon in
the far off distance.  Birds are flying and gliding all about the airship in
curiosity.  This of course has led to a problem, as the airship always
tends to attract birds, and well they do have bodily functions too.  The
swabs are always scraping the dung off the deck.  This part of this ship is
frequented by sailors for its excellent view of the surrounding area -- that
is when they get one of their rare breaks.  

<MAPEND>

>>
s
Before the Bow
  From this foward part of the ship, you have a good vantage point of the
entire ship.  As you look towards the stern, you realize the immensity of
the ship.  Although your vision is somewhat impaired by people who are
walking about, you can just barely see the stern of the ship -- meaning that
the ship is a good eight, nine hundred feet long.  The technology that keeps
this up is terribly frightening.  If they can put a sea-born vessel in the
air, what is next?

Officer's Quarters (G)
  These quarters are lavishly decorated and furbished with the finest
items.  They are arranged about the area in the uniform fashion typical of
this airship.  This is, quite obviously, where the higher-ranking officers

The Captain of the Airship nods at you in agreement.

The Captain yells to the crew and the ship starts to fly.

The Captain orders the crew to lower the ladder.

 somewhere else."
The Captain of the Airship says, "To get back here, all you need to do is
 climb the ladder."
Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east other ]
     A rope ladder is hanging from the Airship here.
(White Aura) A young man is trying to get into the shady tavern.
A nice-looking woman is looking for a caring husband.
A middle-aged man is here, looking for business.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4349/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  862tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578284 | Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun (E*)
>>
Waiting Room
  The interior of the inn looks similar to most inns and tavern in the
land.  The owner obviously modeled it after some of the inns in Conadrain. 
However it appears to be lacking much of the maintenance that a place like
this requires.  Empty beer bottles and dinner plates are spewed across the
floor, many of them being entirely shattered or partially broken.  The floor
is also dotted with spilled beer stains and stains of vomit from people who
obviously had a tad too much to drink.  The particular part of the inn you are
in is really more a foyer for the entire room.  Here if the inn was having
an extremely busy day, guests could rest upon the couches on either side of
the room.  However the inn does not receive many busy days anymore, nor is
this room used for its original purpose, or so it appears.  

<MAPEND>

>>
e
Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun
  The hallway is a complete mess.  Various patrons lay around the hall
sleeping off their drunkenness.  A mirror which was hanging on the wall has
been completely shattered.  It appears it was shattered by someone being
thrown into it, though you can't really be sure of that.  The carpet of the
floor has been torn and treaded upon for a long time.  It's amazing that any
human could live in this sort of environment.  The filth in this room is just
incredible.  The smell could knock out a giant rhinoceros, it's so potent. 
The inn is in desperate need of about thirty or forty good maids.  

<MAPEND>

s
Bedroom
  The first impression which you receive upon entering this bedroom is that
the person or persons living in this room must be incredible slobs.  The
sheets of the bed are lying in the far corner of the room, the bed has
several holes in it, and the headboard of the bed has been entirely kicked
in or something.  At the foot of the bed right by where someone might put
his head is a large pot full of vomit.  Maybe this is the room where they
stick all the people who pass out from their excessive drinking.

Lv 138  G 578284 | Waiting Room (ESW)
>>
s
Bar Room
  A large wooden table is right before you.  Behind this table you can see
all manners of cups, glasses, shotglasses, and bottles of alcohol.  At one
time this bar was quite respectable, however ever since the rebellion has
overrun it, it has been run into the ground with the rest of the inn.  The
once fine mahogany bar table is now full of holes and is stained horribly
from uncleaned spilled drinks and vomit.  Should the rebels ever be ousted
the entire inn, especially the bar would have to be entirely rebuilt. 
Unfortunately this bar table which has stood for such an incredibly long
time, ever since the inn was built many hundreds of years ago, would have to
be thrown away.  Slopped about the room are a few drunks, most have passed
out from the enormous amounts of alcohol which they consume.

Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun
  The hallway is a complete mess.  Various patrons lay around the hall
sleeping off their drunkenness.  A mirror which was hanging on the wall has
been completely shattered.  It appears it was shattered by someone being
thrown into it, though you can't really be sure of that.  The carpet of the
floor has been torn and treaded upon for a long time.  It's amazing that any
human could live in this sort of environment.  The filth in this room is just
incredible.  The smell could knock out a giant rhinoceros, it's so potent. 
The inn is in desperate need of about thirty or forty good maids.

Turn in Hallway
  The hall seems to fork to the north and south here.  The room is
completely dark.  There are a few lamps hanging upon the wall, however they
seem to have been out for quite some time now.  The whole floor seems to
creep every time you take a step in the hall.  The walls look as if they
could cave in at any moment.  It's a wonder this place hasn't been abandoned
and condemned for centuries now.

>>
Room (G)
  This odd room is strikingly different from the rest of the inn.  It is
perhaps the only room in this godforsaken place that isn't scathed with
waste and filth.  Quite the contrary in fact, the room is spic and span the
walls could be shining they are so clean.  A large circular table sits in
the center of the room.  There are about twenty chairs sitting around the
table.  The rebellion is supposedly split into twenty factions, perhaps each
seat is for each leader of each faction.  Though a meeting of all twenty
factions rarely takes place, they leave the option open, should such an
event ever come up.  

<MAPEND>

Sleeping Quarters
  The room which you have just walked into is rather large.  Nearly a
hundred feet long, it stretches for quite some while.  On either side of the
room there are bunks after bunks after bunks.  This room was not originally
part of the inn, but was added when the rebellion overran this place.  They
built these quarters for the bodyguard units of the visiting leaders of the
rebellion.

                     Goal information for: The Empire of Talsa 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Business is where you find it, or can make it. Polaris Star Airlines is 
always looking for a few good people to be employees. Opportunities abound, 
and with civil war in Talsa, there is plenty of gold to be made!

run 3w
Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun (2191)

Waiting Room (2191)

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is

e
Waiting Room
  The interior of the inn looks similar to most inns and tavern in the
land.  The owner obviously modeled it after some of the inns in Conadrain. 
However it appears to be lacking much of the maintenance that a place like
this requires.  Empty beer bottles and dinner plates are spewed across the
floor, many of them being entirely shattered or partially broken.  The floor
is also dotted with spilled beer stains and stains of vomit from people who
obviously had a tad too much to drink.  The particular part of the inn you are
in is really more a foyer for the entire room.  Here if the inn was having
an extremely busy day, guests could rest upon the couches on either side of
the room.  However the inn does not receive many busy days anymore, nor is
this room used for its original purpose, or so it appears.

climb ladder

------------------------------------------------------------
You clutch the rope ladder tightly and pull yourself into the ship.
------------------------------------------------------------
Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Port Side of Airship
  This is the left most part of the ship.  Once has to marvel at the

Before the Bow

this up is terribly frightening.  If they can put a sea-born vessel in the
air, what is next?

Starboard Side of Airship

running around might trip on a piece of trash, which would probably mean
death to the swabs who were suppose to clean that part.

In front of The Bowsprit
  The view from the bowsprit is breathtaking.  You can see the horizon in
the far off distance.  Birds are flying and gliding all about the airship in
curiosity.  This of course has led to a problem, as the airship always
tends to attract birds, and well they do have bodily functions too.  The
swabs are always scraping the dung off the deck.  This part of this ship is
frequented by sailors for its excellent view of the surrounding area -- that
is when they get one of their rare breaks.

Port Deck
  The deck of the ship is full of activity.  Crew members are running here
and there, trying to keep everything running.  However some of the hired
hands are not helping matters.  They are continuously getting in the way, and
causing quite a bit of commotion.  The wind is rather brisk up here, the
mere feel of it is quite exhilarating.  You can see the whole land, as far
as the eye can see, from upon the deck.  Few people ever get a chance to
experience this.

e
Starboard Deck
  The deck is full of life, as crew members prepare for takeoff.  Some are
securing loose objects, others are tying down masts.  Most are trying to
get the mercenaries down below so the others can do their jobs.  A few are
off working on the farthest reaches of the boat.  They appear to be mending
a few of the planks.  Looks like the ship is almost ready for takeoff.  You
wonder where they are going?  Maybe they are heading for one of the capitals.

d


Starboard Side of Airship
  Machines of various types and sizes are here, all working to help keep
the mix of technology and magic that keep the airship aloft.  You can follow
the supports that hold the ship together around the perimeter of this area
and the rest of the airship.  There is also a tall ladder here to climb to
the observation deck above.

Officer's Quarters (G)
  These quarters are lavishly decorated and furbished with the finest
items.  They are arranged about the area in the uniform fashion typical of
this airship.  This is, quite obviously, where the higher-ranking officers
spend much of their personal time.

You say 'conadrain'
The Captain of the Airship nods at you in agreement.
The Captain of the Airship says, "We'll go to Conadrain."

The Captain yells to the crew and the ship starts to fly.
After a few days of travel, you look below and see a field with cows and other livestock.
The Captain orders the crew to lower the ladder.

The Captain of the Airship says, "Okay, we'll be here until you want to go
 somewhere else."
The Captain of the Airship says, "To get back here, all you need to do is
 climb the ladder."
Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!  

<MAPEND>

Lv 138  G 578284 | Wide Field (N*)
>>


n
Grassy Field
  The fields of Conadrain surround you.  Conadrain derives much of its
wealth from the nutrient rich soil within its lands.  They are careful
however to preserve these nutrients and have developed a system to maximize
the use while not destroying the environment.  Many bandits have tried to
steal from these fields, however they always seem to get caught.  It is
rumored that there is a beautiful apple orchard around here somewhere.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) A bull is looking at you.
(Golden Aura) A farmer is working on the fields of the Emperor.

(Golden Aura) A chicken is running around in circles.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  3419/4349 MP  2190/2191 mv  856tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578284 | Grassy Field (NS)
>>
n
Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.  

<MAPEND>

w
Grassy Field
  The fields are dotted with various farmhouses.  These farmhouses are run
by state-hired workers.  These people are trained in the general running of
farmland, as well as breeding.  One of the things that has made the
Conadrain economy shoot up is the excellent products which their highly
advanced breeding program has produced.  Many of the farmers live out here,
though the majority still live in some nearby town.  The rare opportunity of
getting your own farmhouse is only given to the smartest and best farmers in
the employment of the Empire.

>>
Field
  The sheer immensity of the fields, has created hundreds upon hundreds of
jobs for the peasants.  They don't earn a great deal, however the job is
fairly popular for you get a small part of the harvest every year.  This
concession was made when the only way they could get people to work the
fields was to conscript the lowest of peasants.  Everyone knows that a hired
hand works better than a person forced to work.

Heading Towards the Palace
  The large grassy fields part somewhat here.  The part of the field where
the grass parts appears to be some sort of path.  It is unlikely anything
could grow on this ground for it has the looks of ground which has been
tread upon for hundreds of years.  Perhaps this path will take you to the
imperial palace.  Unfortunately you are not sure, and you would not want to
stray onto a path which did not lead to the palace.  Perhaps you should ask
one of the locals about it?

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

help balefire
{help}
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
{helpkeywords}Help Keywords : Balefire.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Fireball.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-18 21:04:06.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
{helpbody}

Syntax: cast balefire <victim>
Damage: fire
Spell Number: 231

After many levels of casting fireballs, the noble mage completely masters
the art of fire and can cast up to six fireballs in one round using the
balefire spell.  This spell targets a single victim.  Primary-class mages
will have more success with this spell than other classes that cast it.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


{/helpbody}
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
{/help}

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4027/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  856tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578284 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>


help disrupt
{help}
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
{helpkeywords}Help Keywords : DISRUPT.
Help Category : Miscellaneous.
Related Helps : Dispel Magic, Cancellation.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-04 09:36:45.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
{helpbody}

Syntax: cast disrupt <spell name>
        cast disrupt <target> <spell name>
Spell Number: 412

A more focused version of the somewhat chaotic Cancellation spell, disrupt
attempts to remove one particular spell affect that is present upon the
target. If no target is specified, the caster is assumed to be trying to
remove the spell from themselves. You can only disrupt a spell if you have
a working knowledge of the spell you wish to disrupt.

Primary stat: Intelligence
Affected by : Luck


{/helpbody}
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
{/help}

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4179/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  856tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578284 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

You say 'conadrain'
The Captain of the Airship nods at you in agreement.
The Captain of the Airship says, "We'll go to Conadrain."

The Captain yells to the crew and the ship starts to fly.
After a few days of travel, you look below and see a field with cows and other livestock.
The Captain orders the crew to lower the ladder.

The Captain of the Airship says, "Okay, we'll be here until you want to go
 somewhere else."
The Captain of the Airship says, "To get back here, all you need to do is
 climb the ladder."
Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Grassy Field (2138)

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

the art of fire and can cast up to six fireballs in one round using the
balefire spell.  This spell targets a single victim.  Primary-class mages

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun

building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns.

against the Empire.

Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can

is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back

has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

Palace Intersection
  The moment you walk into the palace you gawk at the sheer mass of wealth
on display here.  Red silk carpets line the floors and huge chandeliers
hang from the high ceiling.  The amazing thing is that the palace does not
appear to be gaudy or ostentatious.  Most of the riches had been accumulated
slowly over the years from the surplus of the Empire, or the Emperor's
private funds.  Huge hallways extend to your right and left.  Glancing
up you see that the palace extends to a second story.  Maybe there are some
stairs to the north?

Palace Corner

is seamless and beautiful.  The construction of the palace revolutionizes the
thinking of architects throughout the realm.

n
West Hallway
  Working in the Imperial Palace has always been a favorite assignment of
the men in the army.  Only the most elite of the soldiers are selected to
patrol these halls, watch over the Emperor while he is attending to matters
of state, and escort guests to and from the places they need to be.  However
the only reason one might not care to pull guard duty at the palace is the
lack of adventure.  Many of the guards join because of the great stories
their fathers and their grandfathers have told them about the ancient wars. 
In a way though one could look at being behind the lines as favorable, for
you are running almost no risk of being killed.  

<MAPEND>

Northwest Palace Corner
  The hall turns yet again here.  The mere perfection of this palace is a
wondrous thing.  One has to wonder how the architects ever came up with a
design like this.  And the masons must have been the best that there ever
was.  Masonry like this exists nowhere in the world, except here.  Many
people from around the world come here just to gape at the palace.

North Hallway

North Hallway
  The hall is decorated with all manners of pleasantries around here. 
Vases of excellent artistry stand upon grand tables.  Huge and luxurious
pictures of famous aristocrats dot the wall here and there.  This castle is
such a model of other castles in the kingdom.  It is almost as if after this
castle was built, every single other one inside the Empire was built to
resemble this one as closely as possible.  None however have reached
grandness which this castle has achieved through excellent craftsmanship.

Before the Stairs

second floor.

       Talsa : Become Admiral of the Polaris Star Airlines.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Find who needs help in the Airship.

Go around to various places, ask them if they need help. Most of them don't 
speak standard speech, so be careful to say 'Can I help you?' to them." 

The pilot will check your qualifications and tell you when you can become an 
admiral.

Task 4  : Make a trade agreement with Lenna Salvanna.

Task 5  : Make a trade agreement with Bishop Dracul.

Task 6  : Sarah Lonestar's trade agreement.

Sarah says, "Bring me clothing, and jewelry, so I can look pretty and 
sophisticated. Do this, and we can make a deal." 

Task 7  : The Commander's trade agreement.

Commander Scardale says, "We are having trouble in the war; we need weapons 
and armor. Bring me things I can use and we'll have a deal." 

Task 8  : The Cook takes a hand.

A cook says, "Around here we're too busy to stand around thinking. Bring me 
something I can use." 

Task 9  : Make a contract with Talsa.

Ask Talsa to make a contract with Polaris Airlines.

Task 10 : Make a contract between the rebels and Polaris.

Ask the rebels to make a contract with Polaris Airlines.

Palace Intersection (2191)

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries. 

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (south) ]
(Golden Aura) This guard is assigned to this hallway, and you wonder at its importance.

Grassy Field (2189)

Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Mess Hall
  This is the northern half of the mess hall.  It is as large as the
southern half, set up in a very similar fashion -- to accommodate the most
number of people in the smallest comfortable amount of space.  There is an
exit to the west that leads to the main hallway on this level of the
airship.  To the south is the rest of the mess hall and, further beyond,
you can see the cooking area.

Sleeping Quarters
  This is part of the sleeping area for the crew of the airship.  Similar
to the mess hall across the hallway, the sleeping arrangements are set up to
accommodate as large a portion of the crew as possible, while still remaining
semi-comfortable.  The beds are lined up straight and evenly spaced
apart, with just enough room to maneuver between them.

You say 'moricand'
The Captain of the Airship nods at you in agreement.
The Captain of the Airship says, "We'll go to Moricand."

The Captain yells to the crew and the ship starts to fly.
After a few days of travel, you look below and see a good-sized tavern.
The Captain orders the crew to lower the ladder.

The Captain of the Airship says, "Okay, we'll be here until you want to go
 somewhere else."
The Captain of the Airship says, "To get back here, all you need to do is
 climb the ladder."
Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east other ]
     (Magic) A rope ladder is hanging from the Airship here.

(Red Aura) (White Aura) A nice-looking woman is looking for a caring husband.
(Red Aura) A middle-aged man is here, looking for business.

climb ladder

------------------------------------------------------------
You clutch the rope ladder tightly and pull yourself into the ship.
------------------------------------------------------------
Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.  

<MAPEND>

vital passageway.  The airship expands to the north, west, and east.  To the
south, you can see the quarters for the higher-ranking officers who are in

Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Waiting Room (2189)

Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun
  The hallway is a complete mess.  Various patrons lay around the hall
sleeping off their drunkenness.  A mirror which was hanging on the wall has
been completely shattered.  It appears it was shattered by someone being
thrown into it, though you can't really be sure of that.  The carpet of the
floor has been torn and treaded upon for a long time.  It's amazing that any
human could live in this sort of environment.  The filth in this room is just
incredible.  The smell could knock out a giant rhinoceros, it's so potent. 
The inn is in desperate need of about thirty or forty good maids.  

<MAPEND>

Bedroom
  The first impression which you receive upon entering this bedroom is that
the person or persons living in this room must be incredible slobs.  The
sheets of the bed are lying in the far corner of the room, the bed has
several holes in it, and the headboard of the bed has been entirely kicked
in or something.  At the foot of the bed right by where someone might put
his head is a large pot full of vomit.  Maybe this is the room where they
stick all the people who pass out from their excessive drinking.

Lv 138  G 578356 | Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun (ESW)
>>
Waiting Room
  The interior of the inn looks similar to most inns and tavern in the
land.  The owner obviously modeled it after some of the inns in Conadrain. 
However it appears to be lacking much of the maintenance that a place like
this requires.  Empty beer bottles and dinner plates are spewed across the
floor, many of them being entirely shattered or partially broken.  The floor
is also dotted with spilled beer stains and stains of vomit from people who
obviously had a tad too much to drink.  The particular part of the inn you are
in is really more a foyer for the entire room.  Here if the inn was having
an extremely busy day, guests could rest upon the couches on either side of
the room.  However the inn does not receive many busy days anymore, nor is
this room used for its original purpose, or so it appears.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
(Red Aura) (White Aura) A young man is trying to get into the shady tavern.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  3899/4349 MP  2189/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578356 | Waiting Room (ESW)
>>
Bar Room
  A large wooden table is right before you.  Behind this table you can see
all manners of cups, glasses, shotglasses, and bottles of alcohol.  At one
time this bar was quite respectable, however ever since the rebellion has
overrun it, it has been run into the ground with the rest of the inn.  The
once fine mahogany bar table is now full of holes and is stained horribly
from uncleaned spilled drinks and vomit.  Should the rebels ever be ousted
the entire inn, especially the bar would have to be entirely rebuilt. 
Unfortunately this bar table which has stood for such an incredibly long
time, ever since the inn was built many hundreds of years ago, would have to
be thrown away.  Slopped about the room are a few drunks, most have passed
out from the enormous amounts of alcohol which they consume.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
(Red Aura) A middle-aged man is here, looking for business.
(Red Aura) This person seems to be the town drunk.
(Red Aura) A nice-looking woman is looking for a caring husband.
(Red Aura) A beautiful mistress is wandering around here.

n
Room (G)
  This odd room is strikingly different from the rest of the inn.  It is
perhaps the only room in this godforsaken place that isn't scathed with
waste and filth.  Quite the contrary in fact, the room is spic and span the
walls could be shining they are so clean.  A large circular table sits in
the center of the room.  There are about twenty chairs sitting around the
table.  The rebellion is supposedly split into twenty factions, perhaps each
seat is for each leader of each faction.  Though a meeting of all twenty
factions rarely takes place, they leave the option open, should such an
event ever come up.

Sleeping Quarters
  The room which you have just walked into is rather large.  Nearly a
hundred feet long, it stretches for quite some while.  On either side of the
room there are bunks after bunks after bunks.  This room was not originally
part of the inn, but was added when the rebellion overran this place.  They
built these quarters for the bodyguard units of the visiting leaders of the
rebellion.

       Talsa : Become Admiral of the Polaris Star Airlines.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Find who needs help in the Airship.

Go around to various places, ask them if they need help. Most of them don't 
speak standard speech, so be careful to say 'Can I help you?' to them." 

The pilot will check your qualifications and tell you when you can become an 
admiral.

Task 5  : Make a trade agreement with Bishop Dracul.

Task 6  : Sarah Lonestar's trade agreement.

Sarah says, "Bring me clothing, and jewelry, so I can look pretty and 
sophisticated. Do this, and we can make a deal." 

Task 7  : The Commander's trade agreement.

Commander Scardale says, "We are having trouble in the war; we need weapons 
and armor. Bring me things I can use and we'll have a deal." 

Task 8  : Lenna's trade items.

Lenna Salvanna says, "I want treasure. Bring me nice things I can use." 

Task 9  : The Cook takes a hand.

A cook says, "Around here we're too busy to stand around thinking. Bring me 
something I can use."

Ask Talsa to make a contract with Polaris Airlines.

Ask the rebels to make a contract with Polaris Airlines.

  Upon entering this dark, evil place, you can sense that this is a place

light also adds to the effect of the evil in this most unholy place.  To the

too sure.  You feel like you don't want to be here for too long.

n
Before the Altar of Maldenar
  Approaching the center of the room, you can see that it is an
sacrificial altar. It must be to the god of this place. Upon examining
it you can see that it hasn't been used for quite some time. The
knife is still on the altar. Must have been made awhile before the
outlaw of such practices. To the left and right of you the church
continues. To the north you can see a small alcove, probably for the
head of this place.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  3967/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578439 | Before the Altar of Maldenar (NESW)
>>
n
Bishop's Alcove
  The bishop's alcove is very similar to the rest of the church.  The
ceiling is rather low and gives the room a very close and compact feeling. 
Though no windows stand on the walls the room is provided with light from
two sources.  First and foremost there are four small oil lamps in each
corner of the room, additional light is provided by light pouring in from
the holes in the wall in the bell tower which is just above you.  The room
lacks much furniture other than a small cot and a desk which is leaned up
against the right side of the room.  Only two objects lay upon the table, a
small feather pen and the bible of Maldenar.  The bible is a massive
seventy-four volume work compiled by Maldenar when he still lived.  Like
most religions this is the driving force behind the religion of Maldenar
today.  In the far left hand corner of the room a small ladder is leaned up
against the wall which leads up to the bell tower.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south (up) ]
     (Magic) A golden chest rests in the corner here.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) A monk, dressed in black clothes, is meditating to the dark god.
(Red Aura) Dracul, Bishop of the Church of the Dark God, is studying ancient texts.

       Talsa : Become Admiral of the Polaris Star Airlines.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Find who needs help in the Airship.

Go around to various places, ask them if they need help. Most of them don't 
speak standard speech, so be careful to say 'Can I help you?' to them."

admiral.

Sarah says, "Bring me clothing, and jewelry, so I can look pretty and 
sophisticated. Do this, and we can make a deal." 

Task 7  : The Commander's trade agreement.

Commander Scardale says, "We are having trouble in the war; we need weapons 
and armor. Bring me things I can use and we'll have a deal." 

Task 8  : Lenna's trade items.

Lenna Salvanna says, "I want treasure. Bring me nice things I can use." 

Task 9  : Bishop Dracul's requirements.

Bishop Dracul says, "Items for the people and my religion, that's why I'll 
make an agreement." 

Task 10 : The Cook takes a hand.

A cook says, "Around here we're too busy to stand around thinking. Bring me 
something I can use." 

Task 11 : Make a contract with Talsa.

Ask Talsa to make a contract with Polaris Airlines.

Task 12 : Make a contract between the rebels and Polaris.

Ask the rebels to make a contract with Polaris Airlines.

Lv 138  G 578439 | Bishop's Alcove (S[U])
>>
s
w
Before the Altar of Maldenar
  Approaching the center of the room, you can see that it is an
sacrificial altar. It must be to the god of this place. Upon examining
it you can see that it hasn't been used for quite some time. The
knife is still on the altar. Must have been made awhile before the
outlaw of such practices. To the left and right of you the church
continues. To the north you can see a small alcove, probably for the
head of this place.

<MAPEND>

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  3967/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578439 | Before the Altar of Maldenar (NESW)
>>
Western Church Hall
  The church of Maldenar is a dreary and gloomy place for those who may not
worship him.  Only a few remain that enjoy entering this place for their
worship.  Even though the numbers have declined over the years the
zealousness of those who remain is quite intact.  Day after day these people
come to pay homage to their dark god.  They would be willing to do anything
for him, even kill for him.  The age of the church is quite apparent as the
floor creaks and dust seems to be everywhere, it could probably use a nice
overhaul in its design.  However the followers of Maldenar would not dare do
anything to change or hurt this place of their god.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south ]
(Red Aura) A priest of the Dark God is about to travel to Northstar and corrupt.
(Red Aura) This priest is trying to summon a demon.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  3967/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578439 | Western Church Hall (ES)
>>
s
n
Church Hall
  Even though this church is that of an unholy god, the architecture is quite
amazing.  The way that the masons sculpted and carved the stone which makes up
the church is breathtaking.  One part of the design is quite annoying though:
the roof is so low that it makes walking around here difficult, and
definitely adds to the claustrophobic effect.  The church benches are 
for the most part quite empty, but there are a number of worshippers
in the front row.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east ]

Western Church Hall
  The church of Maldenar is a dreary and gloomy place for those who may not
worship him.  Only a few remain that enjoy entering this place for their
worship.  Even though the numbers have declined over the years the
zealousness of those who remain is quite intact.  Day after day these people
come to pay homage to their dark god.  They would be willing to do anything
for him, even kill for him.  The age of the church is quite apparent as the
floor creaks and dust seems to be everywhere, it could probably use a nice
overhaul in its design.  However the followers of Maldenar would not dare do

Eastern Side of The Church
  Walking away from the altar gives you a slight relief. The wall
on this side is lined with benches which the worshippers sit on.
The sunlight of this place is changed by the stain glass windows
lining this wall, which continue south. Some worshippers are 
near the front of this section, for their prayer. It would be best
to be quiet here and as well as the other parts of the building.

Lv 138  G 578439 | Eastern Side of The Church (SW)
>>
s
s
Eastern Church Hall
  The farther away you walk from the center of the church the more a sense
of relief seems to come over you.  The benches which line each side of the
hallway are empty.  Over the years since the order has declined these
benches seem to become more and more empty.  Even still, the ritualistic
chants can still be heard in this part of the church.  The little light
which is flickering through the windows is refracted in such a way that it
leaves an eerie mark up on the room.  The church hallway continues in the
directions of north and south.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A strange looking shaman is praying to the Dark God.
(Red Aura) This priest is trying to summon a demon.
(Red Aura) A priest is sacrificing a corpse to the Dark God.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  3967/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578439 | Eastern Church Hall (NS)
>>
Back of the Church
  The back of the church is rather empty.  The only object that is really
of any importance is a small urn which is propped up against the back wall. 
From this point of the church you can see just how vast this church really
is.  There must be a hundred rows of benches, however less than forty of
them are actually being used.  Off to the west there is a small hallway
which connects this aisle to the western aisle of the church.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north west ]
(Red Aura) A priest of the Dark God is about to travel to Northstar and corrupt.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  3967/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578439 | Back of the Church (NW)
>>
w
Backroom
  This is a storage room of sorts for the church.  The room is in such
disarray it looks like no one has been back here in several years.  The
entire room is clogged by cobwebs which severely hinder your sight and
movement.  The little bit which you can see are pile of large round barrels,
they almost look like kegs of alcohol.  For the most part the are sealed up
tightly, however one seems to have been punctured.  The material that is
dripping out of it seems to be blood.  Maybe these contain the left over
material from their ancient sacrifical rites, though god knows why they
wouldn't dispose of this material in a different manner.  The western aisle
is just a bit to the west.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]

Global Quest: Global Quest # 5922 has been won by Reina - 176th win.

rfa leader

 You have no recollection of any room with that name.
"run n"
run n
Bishop's Alcove
  The bishop's alcove is very similar to the rest of the church.  The
ceiling is rather low and gives the room a very close and compact feeling. 
Though no windows stand on the walls the room is provided with light from
two sources.  First and foremost there are four small oil lamps in each
corner of the room, additional light is provided by light pouring in from
the holes in the wall in the bell tower which is just above you.  The room
lacks much furniture other than a small cot and a desk which is leaned up
against the right side of the room.  Only two objects lay upon the table, a
small feather pen and the bible of Maldenar.  The bible is a massive
seventy-four volume work compiled by Maldenar when he still lived.  Like
most religions this is the driving force behind the religion of Maldenar
today.  In the far left hand corner of the room a small ladder is leaned up
against the wall which leads up to the bell tower.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south (up) ]
     (Magic) A golden chest rests in the corner here.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) A monk, dressed in black clothes, is meditating to the dark god.
(Red Aura) Dracul, Bishop of the Church of the Dark God, is studying ancient texts.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4100/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario)

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4100/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578439 | Bishop's Alcove (SU)
>>
Bell Tower (G)
  After clearing the final step of the ladder the first thing that catches
your attention are the barrages of enormous bells hanging from the roof of
the tower.  The room itself consists of the single railway that stretches
around the entire room, and a small walkway which goes straight under the
bells.  However the only time that walkway is used when the bells are in
desperate need of repair, because should the bells go off when someone is
under them, it could easily deafen a man.  The walls of the tower allow
people to look outside them, which can be useful at times to spot arriving
people long before they actually arrive at the church.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: down ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4100/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  846tnl (Reply: Ospario)

Before the Altar of Maldenar
  Approaching the center of the room, you can see that it is an
sacrificial altar. It must be to the god of this place. Upon examining
it you can see that it hasn't been used for quite some time. The
knife is still on the altar. Must have been made awhile before the
outlaw of such practices. To the left and right of you the church
continues. To the north you can see a small alcove, probably for the
head of this place.

Eastern Church Hall
  The farther away you walk from the center of the church the more a sense
of relief seems to come over you.  The benches which line each side of the
hallway are empty.  Over the years since the order has declined these
benches seem to become more and more empty.  Even still, the ritualistic
chants can still be heard in this part of the church.  The little light
which is flickering through the windows is refracted in such a way that it
leaves an eerie mark up on the room.  The church hallway continues in the
directions of north and south.

Back of the Church
  The back of the church is rather empty.  The only object that is really

is.  There must be a hundred rows of benches, however less than forty of

which connects this aisle to the western aisle of the church.

w
Backroom
  This is a storage room of sorts for the church.  The room is in such
disarray it looks like no one has been back here in several years.  The
entire room is clogged by cobwebs which severely hinder your sight and
movement.  The little bit which you can see are pile of large round barrels,
they almost look like kegs of alcohol.  For the most part the are sealed up
tightly, however one seems to have been punctured.  The material that is
dripping out of it seems to be blood.  Maybe these contain the left over
material from their ancient sacrifical rites, though god knows why they
wouldn't dispose of this material in a different manner.  The western aisle
is just a bit to the west.

Church Hall
  Even though this church is that of an unholy god, the architecture is quite
amazing.  The way that the masons sculpted and carved the stone which makes up
the church is breathtaking.  One part of the design is quite annoying though:
the roof is so low that it makes walking around here difficult, and
definitely adds to the claustrophobic effect.  The church benches are 
for the most part quite empty, but there are a number of worshippers
in the front row.

n
Western Church Hall
  The church of Maldenar is a dreary and gloomy place for those who may not
worship him.  Only a few remain that enjoy entering this place for their
worship.  Even though the numbers have declined over the years the
zealousness of those who remain is quite intact.  Day after day these people
come to pay homage to their dark god.  They would be willing to do anything
for him, even kill for him.  The age of the church is quite apparent as the
floor creaks and dust seems to be everywhere, it could probably use a nice
overhaul in its design.  However the followers of Maldenar would not dare do
anything to change or hurt this place of their god.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.

Waiting Room
  The interior of the inn looks similar to most inns and tavern in the
land.  The owner obviously modeled it after some of the inns in Conadrain. 
However it appears to be lacking much of the maintenance that a place like
this requires.  Empty beer bottles and dinner plates are spewed across the
floor, many of them being entirely shattered or partially broken.  The floor
is also dotted with spilled beer stains and stains of vomit from people who
obviously had a tad too much to drink.  The particular part of the inn you are
in is really more a foyer for the entire room.  Here if the inn was having
an extremely busy day, guests could rest upon the couches on either side of
the room.  However the inn does not receive many busy days anymore, nor is
this room used for its original purpose, or so it appears.

Lv 138  G 578503 | Waiting Room (ESW)
>>
e
e
Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun
  The hallway is a complete mess.  Various patrons lay around the hall
sleeping off their drunkenness.  A mirror which was hanging on the wall has
been completely shattered.  It appears it was shattered by someone being
thrown into it, though you can't really be sure of that.  The carpet of the
floor has been torn and treaded upon for a long time.  It's amazing that any
human could live in this sort of environment.  The filth in this room is just
incredible.  The smell could knock out a giant rhinoceros, it's so potent. 
The inn is in desperate need of about thirty or forty good maids.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]

(Red Aura) A nice-looking woman is looking for a caring husband.
(Red Aura) A middle-aged man is here, looking for business.
(Red Aura) This person seems to be the town drunk.
(Red Aura) This person seems to be the town drunk.

Lv 138  G 578503 | Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun (ESW)
>>
Turn in Hallway
  The hall seems to fork to the north and south here.  The room is
completely dark.  There are a few lamps hanging upon the wall, however they
seem to have been out for quite some time now.  The whole floor seems to
creep every time you take a step in the hall.  The walls look as if they
could cave in at any moment.  It's a wonder this place hasn't been abandoned
and condemned for centuries now.  

<MAPEND>

"run n;wear moricand;give ale lenna;run 2n"
run n;wear moricand;give ale lenna;run 2n
Sleeping Quarters
  The room which you have just walked into is rather large.  Nearly a
hundred feet long, it stretches for quite some while.  On either side of the
room there are bunks after bunks after bunks.  This room was not originally
part of the inn, but was added when the rebellion overran this place.  They
built these quarters for the bodyguard units of the visiting leaders of the
rebellion.  

<MAPEND>

Lv 138  G 578503 | Sleeping Quarters (S)
>>
You give a Mug of Ale to Lenna Salvanna.
Lenna Salvanna exclaims 'Oh! I didn't think you'd actually bring me a drink!'
Lenna Salvanna says 'I'll hold up my end of the bargain.'

She tells you the directions to the church.
You hurriedly leave the inn, and arrive at the church in minutes.

Entrance to Maldenar's Temple
  Upon entering this dark, evil place, you can sense that this is a place
of evil worship.  Faint chants can be heard throughout this room.  The low
light also adds to the effect of the evil in this most unholy place.  To the
north you can see some sort of altar, but from the distance you can not be
too sure.  You feel like you don't want to be here for too long.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
(Red Aura) A monk, dressed in black clothes, is meditating to the dark god.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4139/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  836tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578503 | Entrance to Maldenar's Temple (N)
>>
Before the Altar of Maldenar (2191)

Bishop's Alcove
  The bishop's alcove is very similar to the rest of the church.  The
ceiling is rather low and gives the room a very close and compact feeling. 
Though no windows stand on the walls the room is provided with light from
two sources.  First and foremost there are four small oil lamps in each
corner of the room, additional light is provided by light pouring in from
the holes in the wall in the bell tower which is just above you.  The room
lacks much furniture other than a small cot and a desk which is leaned up
against the right side of the room.  Only two objects lay upon the table, a
small feather pen and the bible of Maldenar.  The bible is a massive
seventy-four volume work compiled by Maldenar when he still lived.  Like
most religions this is the driving force behind the religion of Maldenar
today.  In the far left hand corner of the room a small ladder is leaned up
against the wall which leads up to the bell tower.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south up ]
     (Magic) A golden chest rests in the corner here.
(Red Aura) A monk, dressed in black clothes, is meditating to the dark god.
(Red Aura) Dracul, Bishop of the Church of the Dark God, is studying ancient texts.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4139/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  836tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578503 | Bishop's Alcove (SU)
>>


Enter the command to move to the portal destination
give map bishop
You give a map of the world to Bishop Dracul.
Bishop Dracul asks 'Hello.  How may I help you?'
Bishop Dracul says 'I may be old and frail, but I can tell you things some should not know....'
Bishop Dracul bows before you.
Bishop Dracul exclaims 'Ahh, thank you for finding the map for me!'
Bishop Dracul says 'I can finally finish that project I've been working on.'
Bishop Dracul asks 'Now, you were looking for the rebel fort, right?'

The old man gets up from his chair and moves it aside.
Pushing the carpet out of the way, a trap door is revealed.
After climbing through the trap door, you find yourself in a hallway.
Following the hallway and a ladder bring you to the fortress entrance.

Inside the Rebel Fortress
  The outside walls are covered with a thin layer of mold and other
plant life. But looking at the door, you can tell that it was just put
in, probably as a defense against the Empire's troops. You could
easily walk in because there are no guards present. It makes you wonder
that it probably isn't some big headquarters because otherwise it would be
more well guarded that this.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (down) ]

n
Cramped Intersection
  After walking down the hall from the entrance you can tell that this
was probably once a storage fortress for soldiers. There are a number of
supplies strewn about, which makes this place cramped. Again the 
thoughts that this is not an important place fill your head.
Why would a main headquarters be this badly kept? You shrug and move
on.

Bare Hallway
  As you walk into this part of the fortress, you can tell that this 
place is much cleaner, but why? Very few old supplies lie about
so the smell of mold and dust is not as great as before. With all
of this ruined stuff, you wonder who could live here.

Rebel Hallway
  Judging from the lack for old supplies on the floor, you can tell
that this section of the fort has been clean. Probably as a precaution
in case the leaders have to flee this place. To the north you can
see cleaner hallway; to the east the crowded dirty intersection
calls for you. As you walk around, you can hear some of the rebel
officers talking about what they are going to do when the war is over.
After hearing the stories of the rebels being evil, you don't know
what to think.  They seem normal to you. But you shrug and walk along.

Clean Hallway
  As you walk by here you see a couple of rebel officers sitting on the
ground.  As you listen in you can hear them talking about certain
plans on how to attack the Empire's army. One says that they
don't have enough supplies to do it. Another just looks at you. You
think at least they are not sitting in the dirtier sections of the 
fortress. It might be best to move along and let them plan their 
battle.

Rebel Fortress
  As you proceed to walk down the hall, it is noticeably cleaner than

Staircase to Leader's Quarters
  Your hopes are answered as the stairs are not covered in the same mold
as the walls in the hallway below.  At the top of the staircase is a living
quarter of some kind.  You boggle at the thought that someone would want
to live here as you prepare to climb the stairs.

u
Leader's Quarters
  After climbing up the stairs you can get a better look at this room.
In the middle you can see a table with a bunch of papers on it.
On either side of the room you can see the cots that line the walls. So more
than one person lives here, you think to yourself. They must be crazy.
An even stranger thought comes to your mind:  Could they be the rebellion
leaders? To the north the room continues.

<MAPEND>

n
Leader's Quarters
  This room appears to be more of an office than living space.  You see
more tables and chairs.  On one side of the room a bookcase stands
completely filled with books on various subjects. It would probably
take at least two years to read all of the books. At one of the desks
sits a strong looking man.  He doesn't seem to be looking at you. You
feel safe that he isn't. There is another stair case down and the
remainder of the room to the south.

<MAPEND>

say contract with polaris airlines
You say 'contract with polaris airlines'
Torlad Stormbringer says, "The Polaris guy, welcome.  I am sure you want
 to help us overthrow the tyrant Talsa.  Here is what you need to bring for
 me."
Torlad rubs his chin while looking at you.
Torlad Stormbringer says, "Rumors are, Talsa gives a portal to somewhere
 to the Empire's defenders.  I want one of those portals.  Bring me one,
 I'll make a contract."
Torlad Stormbringer frowns.
Torlad Stormbringer says, "This portal must be one that Talsa gives to you
 personally.  No second-hand stuff, no junk, no fakes."
Torlad Stormbringer snickers softly.
Torlad Stormbringer says, "Tell Talsa you will save souls.  That'll spin
 his top."

Staircase to Leader's Quarters (2191)

Rebel Fortress (2191)

Bare Hallway (2191)

Cramped Intersection (2191)

Inside the Rebel Fortress
  The outside walls are covered with a thin layer of mold and other
plant life. But looking at the door, you can tell that it was just put
in, probably as a defense against the Empire's troops. You could
easily walk in because there are no guards present. It makes you wonder
that it probably isn't some big headquarters because otherwise it would be
more well guarded that this.

Bishop's Alcove (2191)

Before the Altar of Maldenar
  Approaching the center of the room, you can see that it is an
sacrificial altar. It must be to the god of this place. Upon examining
it you can see that it hasn't been used for quite some time. The
knife is still on the altar. Must have been made awhile before the
outlaw of such practices. To the left and right of you the church
continues. To the north you can see a small alcove, probably for the
head of this place.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

(Red Aura) A priest of the Dark God is about to travel to Northstar and corrupt.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4279/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  836tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578503 | Before the Altar of Maldenar (NESW)
>>
n
Bishop's Alcove
  The bishop's alcove is very similar to the rest of the church.  The
ceiling is rather low and gives the room a very close and compact feeling. 
Though no windows stand on the walls the room is provided with light from
two sources.  First and foremost there are four small oil lamps in each
corner of the room, additional light is provided by light pouring in from
the holes in the wall in the bell tower which is just above you.  The room
lacks much furniture other than a small cot and a desk which is leaned up
against the right side of the room.  Only two objects lay upon the table, a
small feather pen and the bible of Maldenar.  The bible is a massive
seventy-four volume work compiled by Maldenar when he still lived.  Like
most religions this is the driving force behind the religion of Maldenar
today.  In the far left hand corner of the room a small ladder is leaned up
against the wall which leads up to the bell tower.  

<MAPEND>

     (Magic) A golden chest rests in the corner here.

>>
w
Western Church Hall
  The church of Maldenar is a dreary and gloomy place for those who may not
worship him.  Only a few remain that enjoy entering this place for their
worship.  Even though the numbers have declined over the years the
zealousness of those who remain is quite intact.  Day after day these people
come to pay homage to their dark god.  They would be willing to do anything
for him, even kill for him.  The age of the church is quite apparent as the
floor creaks and dust seems to be everywhere, it could probably use a nice
overhaul in its design.  However the followers of Maldenar would not dare do
anything to change or hurt this place of their god.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south ]
(Red Aura) A priest of the Dark God is about to travel to Northstar and corrupt.
(Red Aura) This priest is trying to summon a demon.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4349/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  836tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578503 | Western Church Hall (ES)
>>
s
Church Hall
  Even though this church is that of an unholy god, the architecture is quite
amazing.  The way that the masons sculpted and carved the stone which makes up
the church is breathtaking.  One part of the design is quite annoying though:
the roof is so low that it makes walking around here difficult, and
definitely adds to the claustrophobic effect.  The church benches are 
for the most part quite empty, but there are a number of worshippers
in the front row.

<MAPEND>

Lv 138  G 578503 | Church Hall (NE)
>>
e
Backroom
  This is a storage room of sorts for the church.  The room is in such
disarray it looks like no one has been back here in several years.  The
entire room is clogged by cobwebs which severely hinder your sight and
movement.  The little bit which you can see are pile of large round barrels,
they almost look like kegs of alcohol.  For the most part the are sealed up
tightly, however one seems to have been punctured.  The material that is
dripping out of it seems to be blood.  Maybe these contain the left over
material from their ancient sacrifical rites, though god knows why they
wouldn't dispose of this material in a different manner.  The western aisle
is just a bit to the west.  

<MAPEND>

e
Back of the Church
  The back of the church is rather empty.  The only object that is really
of any importance is a small urn which is propped up against the back wall. 
From this point of the church you can see just how vast this church really
is.  There must be a hundred rows of benches, however less than forty of
them are actually being used.  Off to the west there is a small hallway
which connects this aisle to the western aisle of the church.  

<MAPEND>

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4349/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  836tnl (Reply: Ospario) 
Lv 138  G 578503 | Back of the Church (NW)
>>
n
Eastern Church Hall
  The farther away you walk from the center of the church the more a sense
of relief seems to come over you.  The benches which line each side of the
hallway are empty.  Over the years since the order has declined these
benches seem to become more and more empty.  Even still, the ritualistic
chants can still be heard in this part of the church.  The little light
which is flickering through the windows is refracted in such a way that it
leaves an eerie mark up on the room.  The church hallway continues in the
directions of north and south.

Eastern Side of The Church
  Walking away from the altar gives you a slight relief. The wall

lining this wall, which continue south. Some worshippers are

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Open Field
  You are standing in the middle of a vast field.  It would be a
run-of-the-mill field, except for the fact that there's a strange object of
immense size hovering overhead.  The beautiful flying work of art appears to
be a flying ship.  What's even more interesting, is there is a rope ladder
which hangs down from the side of the ship.  It's the perfect invitation for
you to enter.  

<MAPEND>

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Officer's Quarters (G)
  These quarters are lavishly decorated and furbished with the finest
items.  They are arranged about the area in the uniform fashion typical of
this airship.  This is, quite obviously, where the higher-ranking officers
spend much of their personal time.

You say 'conadrain'
The Captain of the Airship nods at you in agreement.
The Captain of the Airship says, "We'll go to Conadrain."

The Captain yells to the crew and the ship starts to fly.
After a few days of travel, you look below and see a field with cows and other livestock.
The Captain orders the crew to lower the ladder.

The Captain of the Airship says, "Okay, we'll be here until you want to go
 somewhere else."
The Captain of the Airship says, "To get back here, all you need to do is
 climb the ladder."
Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Grassy Field (2189)

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.  

<MAPEND>

s
Grassy Field
  The fields of Conadrain surround you.  Conadrain derives much of its
wealth from the nutrient rich soil within its lands.  They are careful
however to preserve these nutrients and have developed a system to maximize
the use while not destroying the environment.  Many bandits have tried to
steal from these fields, however they always seem to get caught.  It is
rumored that there is a beautiful apple orchard around here somewhere.

Grassy Field
  The fields are dotted with various farmhouses.  These farmhouses are run
by state-hired workers.  These people are trained in the general running of
farmland, as well as breeding.  One of the things that has made the
Conadrain economy shoot up is the excellent products which their highly
advanced breeding program has produced.  Many of the farmers live out here,
though the majority still live in some nearby town.  The rare opportunity of
getting your own farmhouse is only given to the smartest and best farmers in
the employment of the Empire.

>>
Field
  The sheer immensity of the fields, has created hundreds upon hundreds of
jobs for the peasants.  They don't earn a great deal, however the job is
fairly popular for you get a small part of the harvest every year.  This
concession was made when the only way they could get people to work the
fields was to conscript the lowest of peasants.  Everyone knows that a hired
hand works better than a person forced to work.

Beginning of the Stairwell
  This is the beginning of the stairwell, the top of the backbone of the
airship.  Enough room is granted to allow for plenty of traffic along this
vital passageway.  The airship expands to the north, west, and east.  To the

Sleeping Quarters
  This area holds beds for the many members of the crew on the airship.

an exit leads east to the lower hallway.

Grassy Field (2190)

Pasture (2189)

Heading Towards the Palace
  The large grassy fields part somewhat here.  The part of the field where
the grass parts appears to be some sort of path.  It is unlikely anything
could grow on this ground for it has the looks of ground which has been
tread upon for hundreds of years.  Perhaps this path will take you to the
imperial palace.  Unfortunately you are not sure, and you would not want to
stray onto a path which did not lead to the palace.  Perhaps you should ask
one of the locals about it?

Sarah Lonestar says 'Now I can go to the palace and complete my work there.'
Sarah Lonestar says 'Come with me!  When your business is done, you can visit my chamber.'
Sarah Lonestar winks suggestively at you.

As the maid walks down the path, you begin to see the palace.
The wonderful design captivates you as you get closer.
The guards stop the maid temporarily, then open the door and step aside.
She leaves as you enter the main hall, off to do some work.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

Palace Intersection (2188)

Before the Stairs
  The stairs before you rise up in a magnificent way.  They spiral up around
and around until they reach the second floor.  The stairs themselves are
constructed of iron.  The iron has been polished to a high shine.  However
most of the iron is not visible, since the stairs are draped in a
purplish velvet.  You glance upwards and wonder what might be up on the
second floor.

give glove Scardale
You give leather training gloves to Commander Scardale.
Commander Scardale exclaims 'Ahh, you brought the gloves I requested!'
Commander Scardale says 'Okay then.  I will take you further into the palace.'

You follow Commander Scardale up the stairs and deeper into the palace.

On top of the stairs
  The sight of the palace upon the second floor is quite breathtaking.  The
things upon the first floor become so much more clear, and visible.  The
upper floor is in somewhat of a disarray.  Papers are thrown about here and
there.  Many people are trying to clean up the mess, but the extent of it is
quite immense.  How could the palace become such a playground? 
Everyone up here seems to either be cleaning or sitting around doing nothing
-- kind of odd for an Emperor's palace.  One would think that they could find
something to do.

n
Beginning of the long hall
  The hall seems to stretch on forever, as far as the eye can see.  Everywhere you
look is hallway, amazingly decorated.  If the halls downstairs were extravagant,
these are priceless -- beautiful vases and giant tapestries adorn the walls.
The tapestries depict the history of the Empire and thus are valuable for both
their subject and their artistry.
