Grassy Field (2379)

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

Palace Intersection
  The moment you walk into the palace you gawk at the sheer mass of wealth
on display here.  Red silk carpets line the floors and huge chandeliers
hang from the high ceiling.  The amazing thing is that the palace does not
appear to be gaudy or ostentatious.  Most of the riches had been accumulated
slowly over the years from the surplus of the Empire, or the Emperor's
private funds.  Huge hallways extend to your right and left.  Glancing
up you see that the palace extends to a second story.  Maybe there are some
stairs to the north?

Beginning of the long hall (2380)

Near the end of the hall (2380)

Before the Council Chamber
  The hall has come to an end here.  Before you lies a door of immense size.
It stands some twelve feet tall and eight feet wide.  A giant could fit
through this door, it is so incredibly large.  The doors are quite shut
right now, because it appears that Talsa is having a council right now. 
Only his closest advisors may enter the chamber during a council.  Many of
the guards are trained to kill any man who might even be attempting to pass
these doors during a council.  Many have tried before now, however none have
survived their attempts.  Sometimes these councils can go on for several days
without any breaks in between.  The longest went on for two and half weeks,
when it was learned that the barbarians to the north of the Empire were
planning a massive assault upon the Empire.  To violate these chambers,
would be to violate the gods of this land and would result in almost
immediate death.

Council chamber
  The council chamber is immensely large.  The room is at least fifty feet
wide and fifty feet long, though the shape of it is rather odd.  The walls
move around to form a more oblong shape than anything else.  A grand
circular table sits in the middle of the room.  Several seats lie around it,
however one in particular is rather large.  That is likely where Talsa
generally sits.  The room is only lit by a single hole in the ceiling of the
palace.  During the day sun comes in through this hole to illuminate the
entire room in a fantastic way.  This however is somewhat limiting for at
night they have to lug in giant lamps to keep the room properly lit.  This
room keeps up with the rest of the splendor of this castle, it is truly an
amazing sight to behold.

       Talsa : Become Admiral of the Polaris Star Airlines.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Find who needs help in the Airship.

Go around to various places, ask them if they need help. Most of them don't 
speak standard speech, so be careful to say 'Can I help you?' to them." 

The pilot will check your qualifications and tell you when you can become an 
admiral.

Task 6  : Sarah Lonestar's trade agreement.

Sarah says, "Bring me clothing, and jewelry, so I can look pretty and 
sophisticated. Do this, and we can make a deal." 

Sarah has a hard time seeing you with the sun in her eyes. Perhaps something 
to block the sun?

Task 7  : The Commander's trade agreement.

Commander Scardale says, "We are having trouble in the war; we need weapons 
and armor. Bring me things I can use and we'll have a deal." 

Task 12 : Make a contract between the rebels and Polaris.

Ask the rebels to make a contract with Polaris Airlines.

Torlad says, "Tell Talsa you will save souls.  That'll spin his top."

Task 14 : Get a portal from Talsa.

Torlad says,"Rumors are, Talsa gives a portal to somewhere to the Empire's 
defenders. I want one of those portals. This portal must be one that Talsa 
gives to you personally. No second-hand stuff, no junk, no fakes." 

Only loyal council members can save souls.

To save souls, the sword Soulsaver must be wielded. Ask Talsa to test you 
when you are ready.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

Open Field
  You are standing in the middle of a vast field.  It would be a
run-of-the-mill field, except for the fact that there's a strange object of
immense size hovering overhead.  The beautiful flying work of art appears to
be a flying ship.  What's even more interesting, is there is a rope ladder
which hangs down from the side of the ship.  It's the perfect invitation for
you to enter.

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.

Waiting Room (2479)

Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun
  The hallway is a complete mess.  Various patrons lay around the hall
sleeping off their drunkenness.  A mirror which was hanging on the wall has
been completely shattered.  It appears it was shattered by someone being
thrown into it, though you can't really be sure of that.  The carpet of the
floor has been torn and treaded upon for a long time.  It's amazing that any
human could live in this sort of environment.  The filth in this room is just
incredible.  The smell could knock out a giant rhinoceros, it's so potent. 
The inn is in desperate need of about thirty or forty good maids.

Sleeping Quarters

rebellion.

Before the Altar of Maldenar (2479)

Bishop's Alcove
  The bishop's alcove is very similar to the rest of the church.  The
ceiling is rather low and gives the room a very close and compact feeling. 
Though no windows stand on the walls the room is provided with light from
two sources.  First and foremost there are four small oil lamps in each
corner of the room, additional light is provided by light pouring in from
the holes in the wall in the bell tower which is just above you.  The room
lacks much furniture other than a small cot and a desk which is leaned up
against the right side of the room.  Only two objects lay upon the table, a
small feather pen and the bible of Maldenar.  The bible is a massive
seventy-four volume work compiled by Maldenar when he still lived.  Like
most religions this is the driving force behind the religion of Maldenar
today.  In the far left hand corner of the room a small ladder is leaned up
against the wall which leads up to the bell tower.

Inside the Rebel Fortress
  The outside walls are covered with a thin layer of mold and other
plant life. But looking at the door, you can tell that it was just put
in, probably as a defense against the Empire's troops. You could
easily walk in because there are no guards present. It makes you wonder
that it probably isn't some big headquarters because otherwise it would be
more well guarded that this.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Open Field
  You are standing in the middle of a vast field.  It would be a
run-of-the-mill field, except for the fact that there's a strange object of
immense size hovering overhead.  The beautiful flying work of art appears to
be a flying ship.  What's even more interesting, is there is a rope ladder
which hangs down from the side of the ship.  It's the perfect invitation for
you to enter.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west other ]
     (Magic) A rope ladder is hanging from the Airship here.

------------------------------------------------------------
You clutch the rope ladder tightly and pull yourself into the ship.
------------------------------------------------------------
Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: up ]
(Hidden) (Red Aura) One of the ship's archers waits for an attack.

Stairwell (2350)

Beginning of the Stairwell (2350)

Officer's Quarters (G)
  These quarters are lavishly decorated and furbished with the finest
items.  They are arranged about the area in the uniform fashion typical of
this airship.  This is, quite obviously, where the higher-ranking officers
spend much of their personal time.

You say 'conadrain'
The Captain of the Airship nods at you in agreement.
The Captain of the Airship says, "We'll go to Conadrain."

The Captain yells to the crew and the ship starts to fly.
After a few days of travel, you look below and see a field with cows and other livestock.
The Captain orders the crew to lower the ladder.

The Captain of the Airship says, "Okay, we'll be here until you want to go
 somewhere else."
The Captain of the Airship says, "To get back here, all you need to do is
 climb the ladder."
Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Grassy Field (2349)

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

Heading Towards the Palace
  The large grassy fields part somewhat here.  The part of the field where
the grass parts appears to be some sort of path.  It is unlikely anything
could grow on this ground for it has the looks of ground which has been
tread upon for hundreds of years.  Perhaps this path will take you to the
imperial palace.  Unfortunately you are not sure, and you would not want to
stray onto a path which did not lead to the palace.  Perhaps you should ask
one of the locals about it?

       Talsa : Become Admiral of the Polaris Star Airlines.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Find who needs help in the Airship.

Go around to various places, ask them if they need help. Most of them don't 
speak standard speech, so be careful to say 'Can I help you?' to them." 

The pilot will check your qualifications and tell you when you can become an 
admiral.

Task 7  : The Commander's trade agreement.

Commander Scardale says, "We are having trouble in the war; we need weapons 
and armor. Bring me things I can use and we'll have a deal."

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.

Waiting Room (2346)

Turn in Hallway (2346)

Sleeping Quarters
  The room which you have just walked into is rather large.  Nearly a
hundred feet long, it stretches for quite some while.  On either side of the
room there are bunks after bunks after bunks.  This room was not originally
part of the inn, but was added when the rebellion overran this place.  They
built these quarters for the bodyguard units of the visiting leaders of the
rebellion.

Turn in Hallway
  The hall seems to fork to the north and south here.  The room is
completely dark.  There are a few lamps hanging upon the wall, however they
seem to have been out for quite some time now.  The whole floor seems to
creep every time you take a step in the hall.  The walls look as if they
could cave in at any moment.  It's a wonder this place hasn't been abandoned
and condemned for centuries now.

Hallway in The House of The Rising Sun
  The hallway is a complete mess.  Various patrons lay around the hall
sleeping off their drunkenness.  A mirror which was hanging on the wall has
been completely shattered.  It appears it was shattered by someone being
thrown into it, though you can't really be sure of that.  The carpet of the
floor has been torn and treaded upon for a long time.  It's amazing that any
human could live in this sort of environment.  The filth in this room is just
incredible.  The smell could knock out a giant rhinoceros, it's so potent. 
The inn is in desperate need of about thirty or forty good maids.

w
scan
Waiting Room
  The interior of the inn looks similar to most inns and tavern in the
land.  The owner obviously modeled it after some of the inns in Conadrain. 
However it appears to be lacking much of the maintenance that a place like
this requires.  Empty beer bottles and dinner plates are spewed across the
floor, many of them being entirely shattered or partially broken.  The floor
is also dotted with spilled beer stains and stains of vomit from people who
obviously had a tad too much to drink.  The particular part of the inn you are
in is really more a foyer for the entire room.  Here if the inn was having
an extremely busy day, guests could rest upon the couches on either side of
the room.  However the inn does not receive many busy days anymore, nor is
this room used for its original purpose, or so it appears.

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Before the Bow (2351)

In front of The Bowsprit
  The view from the bowsprit is breathtaking.  You can see the horizon in
the far off distance.  Birds are flying and gliding all about the airship in
curiosity.  This of course has led to a problem, as the airship always
tends to attract birds, and well they do have bodily functions too.  The
swabs are always scraping the dung off the deck.  This part of this ship is
frequented by sailors for its excellent view of the surrounding area -- that
is when they get one of their rare breaks.

Before the Bow
  From this foward part of the ship, you have a good vantage point of the
entire ship.  As you look towards the stern, you realize the immensity of
the ship.  Although your vision is somewhat impaired by people who are
walking about, you can just barely see the stern of the ship -- meaning that
the ship is a good eight, nine hundred feet long.  The technology that keeps
this up is terribly frightening.  If they can put a sea-born vessel in the
air, what is next?

can see the expansiveness of the airship and the vast numbers of its crew.

equipment that makes it tick.

Port Side of Airship
  This is the left most part of the ship.  Once has to marvel at the

well is another thing it is obvious from how the crew is conducting
themselves that they are real professionals.  Anyone would be lucky to serve
upon this grand vessel.

The Captain of the Airship nods at you in agreement.

 somewhere else."
The Captain of the Airship says, "To get back here, all you need to do is
 climb the ladder."
Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Grassy Field (2350)

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

Palace Intersection
  The moment you walk into the palace you gawk at the sheer mass of wealth
on display here.  Red silk carpets line the floors and huge chandeliers
hang from the high ceiling.  The amazing thing is that the palace does not
appear to be gaudy or ostentatious.  Most of the riches had been accumulated
slowly over the years from the surplus of the Empire, or the Emperor's
private funds.  Huge hallways extend to your right and left.  Glancing
up you see that the palace extends to a second story.  Maybe there are some
stairs to the north?

Before the Stairs
  The stairs before you rise up in a magnificent way.  They spiral up around
and around until they reach the second floor.  The stairs themselves are
constructed of iron.  The iron has been polished to a high shine.  However
most of the iron is not visible, since the stairs are draped in a
purplish velvet.  You glance upwards and wonder what might be up on the
second floor.

On top of the stairs
  The sight of the palace upon the second floor is quite breathtaking.  The
things upon the first floor become so much more clear, and visible.  The
upper floor is in somewhat of a disarray.  Papers are thrown about here and
there.  Many people are trying to clean up the mess, but the extent of it is
quite immense.  How could the palace become such a playground? 
Everyone up here seems to either be cleaning or sitting around doing nothing
-- kind of odd for an Emperor's palace.  One would think that they could find
something to do.

>>
Beginning of the long hall (2346)

Near the end of the hall (2346)

Before the Council Chamber
  The hall has come to an end here.  Before you lies a door of immense size.
It stands some twelve feet tall and eight feet wide.  A giant could fit
through this door, it is so incredibly large.  The doors are quite shut
right now, because it appears that Talsa is having a council right now. 
Only his closest advisors may enter the chamber during a council.  Many of
the guards are trained to kill any man who might even be attempting to pass
these doors during a council.  Many have tried before now, however none have
survived their attempts.  Sometimes these councils can go on for several days
without any breaks in between.  The longest went on for two and half weeks,
when it was learned that the barbarians to the north of the Empire were
planning a massive assault upon the Empire.  To violate these chambers,
would be to violate the gods of this land and would result in almost
immediate death.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south ]
     (Magic) A large brown sack lies here

A small party of guards escorts you to Talsa's council chambers.

Council chamber
  The council chamber is immensely large.  The room is at least fifty feet
wide and fifty feet long, though the shape of it is rather odd.  The walls
move around to form a more oblong shape than anything else.  A grand
circular table sits in the middle of the room.  Several seats lie around it,
however one in particular is rather large.  That is likely where Talsa
generally sits.  The room is only lit by a single hole in the ceiling of the
palace.  During the day sun comes in through this hole to illuminate the
entire room in a fantastic way.  This however is somewhat limiting for at
night they have to lug in giant lamps to keep the room properly lit.  This
room keeps up with the rest of the splendor of this castle, it is truly an
amazing sight to behold.

Palace Intersection
  The moment you walk into the palace you gawk at the sheer mass of wealth
on display here.  Red silk carpets line the floors and huge chandeliers
hang from the high ceiling.  The amazing thing is that the palace does not
appear to be gaudy or ostentatious.  Most of the riches had been accumulated
slowly over the years from the surplus of the Empire, or the Emperor's
private funds.  Huge hallways extend to your right and left.  Glancing
up you see that the palace extends to a second story.  Maybe there are some
stairs to the north?

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

Before the Altar of Maldenar (2351)

Bishop's Alcove
  The bishop's alcove is very similar to the rest of the church.  The
ceiling is rather low and gives the room a very close and compact feeling. 
Though no windows stand on the walls the room is provided with light from
two sources.  First and foremost there are four small oil lamps in each
corner of the room, additional light is provided by light pouring in from
the holes in the wall in the bell tower which is just above you.  The room
lacks much furniture other than a small cot and a desk which is leaned up
against the right side of the room.  Only two objects lay upon the table, a
small feather pen and the bible of Maldenar.  The bible is a massive
seventy-four volume work compiled by Maldenar when he still lived.  Like
most religions this is the driving force behind the religion of Maldenar
today.  In the far left hand corner of the room a small ladder is leaned up
against the wall which leads up to the bell tower.

Inside the Rebel Fortress
  The outside walls are covered with a thin layer of mold and other

in, probably as a defense against the Empire's troops. You could
easily walk in because there are no guards present. It makes you wonder
that it probably isn't some big headquarters because otherwise it would be
more well guarded that this.

Leader's Quarters (2351)

Leader's Quarters
  This room appears to be more of an office than living space.  You see
more tables and chairs.  On one side of the room a bookcase stands
completely filled with books on various subjects. It would probably
take at least two years to read all of the books. At one of the desks
sits a strong looking man.  He doesn't seem to be looking at you. You
feel safe that he isn't. There is another stair case down and the
remainder of the room to the south.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Open Field
  You are standing in the middle of a vast field.  It would be a
run-of-the-mill field, except for the fact that there's a strange object of
immense size hovering overhead.  The beautiful flying work of art appears to
be a flying ship.  What's even more interesting, is there is a rope ladder
which hangs down from the side of the ship.  It's the perfect invitation for
you to enter.

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

 somewhere else."

 climb the ladder."
Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

Grassy Field (2349)

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

Heading Towards the Palace
  The large grassy fields part somewhat here.  The part of the field where
the grass parts appears to be some sort of path.  It is unlikely anything
could grow on this ground for it has the looks of ground which has been
tread upon for hundreds of years.  Perhaps this path will take you to the
imperial palace.  Unfortunately you are not sure, and you would not want to
stray onto a path which did not lead to the palace.  Perhaps you should ask
one of the locals about it?

As the maid walks down the path, you begin to see the palace.

The guards stop the maid temporarily, then open the door and step aside.
She leaves as you enter the main hall, off to do some work.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries.

Palace Intersection
  The moment you walk into the palace you gawk at the sheer mass of wealth
on display here.  Red silk carpets line the floors and huge chandeliers
hang from the high ceiling.  The amazing thing is that the palace does not
appear to be gaudy or ostentatious.  Most of the riches had been accumulated
slowly over the years from the surplus of the Empire, or the Emperor's
private funds.  Huge hallways extend to your right and left.  Glancing
up you see that the palace extends to a second story.  Maybe there are some
stairs to the north?

Before the Stairs
  The stairs before you rise up in a magnificent way.  They spiral up around
and around until they reach the second floor.  The stairs themselves are
constructed of iron.  The iron has been polished to a high shine.  However
most of the iron is not visible, since the stairs are draped in a
purplish velvet.  You glance upwards and wonder what might be up on the
second floor.

Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can

Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

Field Outside The House of The Rising Sun
  The land around here has been ravaged by many battles.  The rebellion is
always in a constant state of warfare.  You stand outside the House of The
Rising Sun, an inn notorious for being a rebellion hideout.  It is visited
by the scum of the earth, and the lowest creatures of the land.  The
building itself is quite a landmark in its own historical right.  Before the
rebellion it was known throughout the land as one of the finest inns. 
However the rebellion has overrun it and turned it into a base of operations
against the Empire.

Grassy Field (2345)

Pasture
  The fertile land around here has undergone special care to grow plant life
suited to grazing.  Besides being known for their excellent crops, the
Conadrains produce some of the best meat in the Empire.  The quality of
their products has allowed them to create a virtual monopoly in the
agricultural business.  This has lead to the annexation of a few smaller
surrounding countries who could not afford to run themselves, since no one
would buy their food.

Heading Towards the Palace
  The large grassy fields part somewhat here.  The part of the field where
the grass parts appears to be some sort of path.  It is unlikely anything
could grow on this ground for it has the looks of ground which has been
tread upon for hundreds of years.  Perhaps this path will take you to the
imperial palace.  Unfortunately you are not sure, and you would not want to
stray onto a path which did not lead to the palace.  Perhaps you should ask
one of the locals about it?

You give a Vegetable to Sarah Lonestar.
Sarah Lonestar exclaims 'Oh, thank you!  Thank you!'
Sarah Lonestar says 'Now I can go to the palace and complete my work there.'
Sarah Lonestar says 'Come with me!  When your business is done, you can visit my chamber.'
Sarah Lonestar winks suggestively at you.

As the maid walks down the path, you begin to see the palace.
The wonderful design captivates you as you get closer.
The guards stop the maid temporarily, then open the door and step aside.
She leaves as you enter the main hall, off to do some work.

Entrance to Palace
  The palace of the Conadrains lies before you.  It is renown for its beauty  
across the entire empire, even past the empire into lands unknown.  The
palace was constructed in the third year of the second emperor reign.  Back
then the empire was small and only included the land just around Conadrain. 
So the palace was not even a tenth of what is now.  It was constructed of pure
gold and was entirely renovated a few years ago.  The greatness of this palace
has proved itself through century after century of rebellions and war.  It was
prophezied along time ago, so long as this palace stands, the empire will
remain intact.  And it has withstanded from invasions for many, many centuries. 

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) This guard is assigned to this hallway, and you wonder at its importance.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3184/3588 HP  2705/4329 MP  2350/2351 mv  642tnl  
Lv 138  G 607476 | Entrance to Palace (NS)
>>
Palace Intersection
  The moment you walk into the palace you gawk at the sheer mass of wealth
on display here.  Red silk carpets line the floors and huge chandeliers
hang from the high ceiling.  The amazing thing is that the palace does not
appear to be gaudy or ostentatious.  Most of the riches had been accumulated
slowly over the years from the surplus of the Empire, or the Emperor's
private funds.  Huge hallways extend to your right and left.  Glancing
up you see that the palace extends to a second story.  Maybe there are some
stairs to the north?

<MAPEND>

>>
Before the Stairs
  The stairs before you rise up in a magnificent way.  They spiral up around
and around until they reach the second floor.  The stairs themselves are
constructed of iron.  The iron has been polished to a high shine.  However
most of the iron is not visible, since the stairs are draped in a
purplish velvet.  You glance upwards and wonder what might be up on the
second floor.

<MAPEND>

Pasture (2349)

Grassy Field (2348)

Wide Field
  The fields of Conadrain are enormous, stretching as far as the eye can
see.  A large breeze stirs the foot tall grass in beautiful waves.  The area
is cloaked in the shadow of the airship, and you notice some rope trailing
beneath the beast.  The palace of the Conadrains lies a few miles ahead as
these are the fields of the Prince himself!

You clutch the rope ladder tightly and pull yourself into the ship.
------------------------------------------------------------
Bottom Cargo Hold of the Airship
  The rope ladder you climbed emptied you into this vast hold.  There are
crates of varied shapes and sizes scattered about the hold.  They appear to
be stacked in some semblance of order, most with a small and barely readable
script on them.  Hidden amongst a few larger crates in the corner is a
ladder leading up to the main stairwell of the airship.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>

INFO: All please welcome Deanie back from recreation!
Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east ]

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3236/3748 HP  2770/4329 MP  2229/2231 mv  642tnl  
Lv 138  G 622449 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Inside the foyer
  Such a quaint little foyer this is. Sandwiched between two sets of doors; 
glass to the north and solid oak to the south. Through the glass doors to the
north, a bustling diner can be seen. The clinks and clanks of a busy diner 
can be heard. Small pictures hang on the wooden walls, some with signatures, 
and a small lantern hangs from the ceiling.

The hostess stand
  Directly in the center of this room stands a large, wooden table. On top of 
the table lies a book with pages full of writing, scribblings, and other 
markings that are barely legible. This must be the host's stand, where all 
reservations are kept to try to preserve order throughout the dinner shift.
It is so loud in here, one can barely hear a pin drop! Tables can be seen to 
the west and east, while the aisle continues north. The foyer is to the 
south.

The hostess stand
  Directly in the center of this room stands a large, wooden table. On top of 
the table lies a book with pages full of writing, scribblings, and other 
markings that are barely legible. This must be the host's stand, where all 
reservations are kept to try to preserve order throughout the dinner shift.
It is so loud in here, one can barely hear a pin drop! Tables can be seen to 
the west and east, while the aisle continues north. The foyer is to the 
south.

Inside the foyer
  Such a quaint little foyer this is. Sandwiched between two sets of doors; 
glass to the north and solid oak to the south. Through the glass doors to the
north, a bustling diner can be seen. The clinks and clanks of a busy diner 
can be heard. Small pictures hang on the wooden walls, some with signatures, 
and a small lantern hangs from the ceiling.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

help sorcerer
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Sorcerer.
Help Category : Classes.
Related Helps : Classes.
Last Updated  : 2013-06-25 23:44:20.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-[*]=--=[+]=-=[*]=-=[+]=-=[  SORCERER SUBCLASS   ]=-=[+]=-=[*]=--=[+]=--=[*]-

   Specialized in sorcery and witchcraft, Sorcerers have a wide range of 
   abilities to weaken, confuse, restrict and inflict extra damage upon 
   their victims.

   Special abilities available to the Sorcerer subclass:

   Power Projection    Petrify            Hex of Entropy
   Spear of Odin       Curse of Sloth     Hex of Misfortune

   Sorcerer is a Mage Guild subclass and only available when Mage is 
   chosen as the primary guild.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

help elementalist
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Elementalist.
Help Category : Classes.
Related Helps : Classes.
Last Updated  : 2016-11-25 11:42:00.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-[*]=--=[+]=--=[*]=-=[+]=-=[ELEMENTALIST SUBCLASS]=-=[+]=-=[*]=--=[+]=--=[*]-

   Masters of the elements, members of this subclass enjoy 
   enhanced control over earth-, wind-, fire-, and water-
   related abilities, whether defensive or offensive in nature.


   Special skills/spells available to characters with the 
   elementalist subclass:

   Elemental Focus   Elemental ward   Air Skewer
   Earthen Hammer    Ice Daggers      

   Bonuses:

   None

   Note:  Elementalist is a subclass of Mage.

help classchange
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Classchange.
Help Category : Utility.
Related Helps : Primary Class, Rebuild, Subclass.
Last Updated  : 2023-07-15 12:05:01.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax:

  classchange <password> <subclass> <race>
  classchange <password> <subclass> <race> [options] 
  classchange check
  classchange cancel

Options:
 
  noinstinct: Don't reset instinct.
  nomastery : Don't reset mastery.
  sameclass : Confirm when using classchange to rebuild instinct/mastery.

Summary:

This command is used to change your primary class, rebuild instinct and
rebuild masteries. It can be used free of charge every 7 days or at any
time at a cost of 1000QPs.

There is an FAQ at the end of this help file for how to do specific 
things such as change masteries or your main class only.

Type 'classchange check' to check the cost of a classchange.
Type 'classchange cancel' to back-out of the class changing process.

Detail:

Below are some important extra details about classchanges

* If your password contains a space, you will need to put single 
  quotes around it when using the classchange command: 
    classchange '<password>' <subclass> <race>.

* If you want to rebuild mastery or instinct only, classchange into 
  the same class. 

* If you choose a class that you have not yet remorted into, your 
  old primary class is completely removed and you will no longer have 
  access to those skills/ spells until you remort back into your former 
  class. If you already have the changed class, they simply swap. The
  game will return some practices based on the skills you lose during the
  classchange.

* The first class change on your character is free; subsequent class 
  changes are free every 7 days or at a cost of 1000QP if you don't want
  to wait.

You must type the classchange command twice to confirm the changes. If 
you change your mind or make a mistake, you can use 'classchange 
cancel' to back out.

Automatic rebuild:

Because of the emphasis on different stats in each class, when changing to
a new primary class, your character will automatically have stats reset as 
if you had used the rebuild command. Stats will need to be re-trained, and 
any tier/wish stats will need to be set again. This works the same way as a 
regular rebuild and does count as your first rebuild in the game.

Practiced amount in skills is not reset except for when you are losing 
access to a skill because it is class/subclass only. The game will 
return some practices when this is the case.

Frequently Asked Questions:
---------------------------

* How do I classchange only, leaving instinct and mastery in place?

   Example: classchange [password] avenger elf nomastery noinstinct

* How do I rebuild only masteries or only instinct?

    classchange [password] [current class] [currentrace] sameclass

  If you only want to do instinct *or* mastery, add 'noinstinct' or 
  'nomastery' option to exclude the other.

  You may also use the old mastery and instinct commands at a cost of 
  500qp. Refer to those helpfiles for more details.

* How can I change subclass only?

  Keep all other options other than subclass the same as they already are 
  and add the 'sameclass' option. For example, if you are an elf paladin-
  avenger and want to become an elf paladin-guardian:

    classchange [password] guardian elf sameclass

  Remember to add noinstinct and nomastery if you really want to change
  *only* subclass.

* How can I use this to change race only?

  Keep all options other than race the same as they already are and add
  the 'sameclass' option. For example, if you are an elf paladin-avenger 
  and want to become a vampire paladin-avenger:

    classchange [password] avenger vampire sameclass

  Remember to add noinstinct and nomastery if you really want to change
  *only* race.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3150/3698 HP  4153/4349 MP  2191/2191 mv  514tnl  
Lv 138  G 628533 | Recreation Room (ESW)
>>

         classchange <password> <new subclass> <new race> [options]
         classchange check
Options: nomastery, noinstinct, sameclass.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

help races
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Race Help' Races Race.
Help Category : Races.
Related Helps : Classes.
Last Updated  : 2013-08-10 11:27:08.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-=[*]=--=[+]=--=[*]=--=[+]=--=[ AARDWOLF RACES ]=--=[+]=--=[*]=--=[+]=--=[*]=-

Human    : The standard race. Jack of all trades, master of none.
Dwarf    : Short stocky folk with well balanced attributes.
Elf      : Wise and intelligent race. Make great mages.
Giant    : Very strong race but not too bright. Make great warriors.
Halfling : Short agile sneaky folk. Tend to be very good thieves.
Half-Grif: Strong magical flying race. Suited to all classes.
Troll    : Big, green ugly brutes with regeneration.
Sprite   : An invisible flying little faerie who excels at magic.
Quickling: Outcasts of the faeries. Very fast moving but weak. 
Dark elf : The drow, highly intelligent but with a bad attitude.
Centaur  : Half-human half-horse fearsome and strong beast.
Vampire  : Fearsome dwellers of the night. Masters of the undead.
Wolfen   : Natural hunters of the realm. Extremely agile.
Ratling  : Giant rat-like creatures. Good all-around race.
Diva     : Created by the Earth mother from the elements of nature.
Shadow   : Ethereal beings suited to spellcasting and thievery.
Triton   : Warriors of their natural habitat - the ocean.
Lizard   : Small mutant 'lizard men' expert in poisons.
Eldar    : Masters of magic and lore but poor fighters.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Refer to each race helpfile for details, for example 'help elf'. Also see
'help raceinfo' for training costs. See 'help races<classname>' for 
suggested races within each class.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3274/3453 HP  4224/4224 MP  2325/2881 mv  514tnl

help half-grif
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : HALF-GRIFFON HALF-GRIFFONS HALFGRIFFON 'half griffon'.
Help Category : Races.
Related Helps : Races.
Last Updated  : 2012-05-28 18:22:00.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-[*]=--=[+]=--=[*]=--=[+]=--=[ AARDWOLF RACES ]=--=[+]=--=[*]=--=[+]=--=[*]-
Half-Griffons are a strange magical race created by a mad wizard. This
wizard loved griffons and had many as pets, but he was not able to teach
them anything since they were too wild to be tamed, so he decided to make
them more human-like. Half-Griffons are very rare, often taking up the
adventuring road to survive. Half-griffons are swift, agile, and quite
intelligent, thus being able to handle just about any class with ease. Their
unusual creation means half-griffons are less well put together than other
races and pay a penalty in their constitution and wisdom. Their agile minds
and familiarity with the air offers them protection against air and mental
attacks, but they should be wary of what a strong crushing blow can do to
their fragile hollow bones.

                         STR  INT  WIS  DEX  CON LUCK
H-Griffon Start Stats  :  13   14   13   14   13   15
Training Costs         :   0   -1   +1   -1   +1    0

Permanent Affects      : None.
Permanent Skills       : Flying.

NOTE: Stats are very important on Aardwolf. See 'help train' and 'help
      raceinfo' for information on max stats and the training costs.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
INFO: 5 minutes of bonus experience remaining.

classchange 8th38WTwfLPsQVE.eFHA elementalist half-griffon sameclass

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This command changes your primary class and can only be reversed by another
classchange.

Unless 'NOMASTERY' or 'NOINSTINCT' are added as arguments, it will also reset
your mastery and instinct. Please make sure that you have read and understand
HELP CLASSCHANGE.

Classchange Options:
  Cost             : 0 Quest Points

Type 'classchange <password> <subclass> <race> sameclass confirm' to confirm this command.
Type 'classchange cancel' to undo classchange status.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.

this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

w
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4349/4349 MP  2189/2191 mv  496tnl  
Lv 138  G 628233 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>
help heal
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : HEAL HEALER.
Help Category : Utility.
Related Helps : Black Lotus, Cure Light, Cure Serious, Cure Critical, Heal Spell, Refresh, Remove
Curse.
Last Updated  : 2012-12-23 04:48:09.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If you were looking for help on the Heal spell, see 'help heal spell'.

Syntax:  heal            : List heal options, keywords, and costs
         heal <keyword>  : Buy given healer option

The 'heal' command is used to interact with an in-room healer mobile, such
as the priestess north of recall.  Healers are able to sell healing and
curative spells, for a price.

Type 'heal' in a room with a healer mobile to find the charges for each
spell.  If there is no healer in the room you're in, you will be told such.

Type heal with the desired argument to purchase that spell.  It will be
cast only once; you may need to buy it again if it is unsuccessful.  Also,
note that some healers are more powerful than others.  If you are having
difficulty getting a successful casting, you may want to find a different
healer.  (Rumor has it that clan healers generally get more business and
are thus a bit more experienced than their counterparts out in the field.)

Healer mobiles will give out (for free) a few spells to players level 20
and under, if that player is willing to wait for them.  This is best
accomplished in rooms that do not have a lot of other traffic.

There is also a video which shows what to do at a healer on Aardwolf:

                      http://youtu.be/te7hIu09kYU

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3698/3698 HP  4349/4349 MP  2189/2191 mv  496tnl  
Lv 138  G 628233 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A path heading west

be a village up ahead.  A question pops up in your head, and you ask

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Into the Sunset Camp
  Finding yourself inside the Sunset Camp, you find yourself gazing in

now you notice it isn't.  You start to jog your memory as you remember that

sandstorm hit the world and covered everything in miles of sand, you realize
that you have uncovered the last camp.

e
Sunset Training Area
  While exploring this campsite, you hear people screaming and yelling. 
You notice that you have stumbled onto the training grounds of the Sunset
Camp.  Here, fierce warriors are trained in order to protect their village
in case of any intruders.  All the warriors are practicing with their mighty
weapons, getting more and more experience as time passes.  Along side the
warriors are their brave warhorses, ready to take their masters to their
destination.  

<MAPEND>

Sunset Training Area
  Deeper inside the training area, you notice a couple of warriors training
together.  As they bow to each other, they wield their maces with intensity
and start to duel.  Moving like they are dancing with each other, they fight
with globs of concentration.  You notice their quickness in speed as one
thrashes with his mace and the other dodges.

Deeper into the Sunset Camp
  Getting deeper within the Sunset Camp, rows of huts and tents are built
neatly together.  This village seems too good to be true as you notice how
everyone here helps one another to build homes and gather supplies.  The

w
Deeper into the Sunset Camp
  Deeper into the Sunset Camp you find yourself at an intersection.  To the
north and south you find two huts aligned equally.  To the west you find the
sun almost setting and to the east is where you came from.  Having trouble
making your decision on which path to pick you look up at the sun for some
advice.  It motions for you to continue your journey as your heart desires.

Sunset Armor and Weapon Storage
  Arriving at the Blacksmith's shop, you can feel the heat against your
face as the blacksmith melts steel and shapes it into swords and axes.  The
sharp banging of hammer on hot steel tells you that the blacksmith is busy
making another weapon.  On the walls, weapons are hung up showing the
blacksmith's special skills in making weapons.  There is also a list of
prices for each of his weapons.

w
Following the Westward Path
  As you stumble westward, you find that the only way is north.  Dying from
the heat, you drip with sweat profusely until it washes the desert floor. 
As you stare into the sky, the Sunset calms your body and cools it in a
magical way.  This good feeling overtakes your body and gives you the
strength to move on.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east ]
     (Magic) The sun continues to set westward.
(Invis) (Hidden) A Sunrise spy is here sneaking around.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3164/3698 HP  4144/4349 MP  2128/2191 mv  388tnl  
Lv 138  G 634908 | Following the Westward Path (NE)
>>
n
Into the Sunset
  Still wandering in this wonderful camp, you find yourself at crossroads. 
A magical beam shining in the west begins to drag you in that direction.  As
you turn yourself east, you notice many priests holding hands and chanting. 
Putting your feet down, you stop the beam from taking you westward.  You
raise your hand to your chin and wonder which way to go.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
     (Magic) The sun continues to set westward.
A lost wanderer is here lost.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3164/3698 HP  4144/4349 MP  2125/2191 mv  388tnl  
Lv 138  G 634908 | Into the Sunset (ESW)
>>
A Sunset
  Drawn into the Sunset you notice the pretty highlighted colors.  Flashing
red, yellow, and orange, your eyes twinkle from excitement.  Staring
straight at the Sunset, you feel your pain subsiding.  Moving slowly down,
the sun begins to hide behind the landscape and you notice it is the end of
the day.  Finding yourself exhausted, you decide to look for shelter.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east ]
     (Magic) The sunset falls beautifully.
(Red Aura) Taji's personal guard is here questioning everyone.

Sunset Leader's Hut
  At the Sunset leader's hut, you find yourself almost sideswiped as an
advisor comes charging at you.  Quickly moving out the way, you feel another
advisor push you to the side.  As the advisors overlook your presence, you
decide to sit down and watch them converse.  Standing in the opposite corner
of you is Taji who is busily meditating.

>>
Sunset Worship Hut
  Feeling dehydrated and hungry, you wander around this room meaninglessly.
You notice four priests holding hands and chanting out loud.  Staring at
them, your vision blurs so you close your eyes.  Meditating to their
chanting, you reach harmony as your soul projects out of your body.  As
another soul appears, he tells you to stop Desert Doom.  As you ask him how,
you are awakened by the priests.  You wonder if you were dreaming or not.  

<MAPEND>

(Red Aura) A Sunset priest is here praying quietly.

Deeper into the Sunset Camp
  Deeper into the Sunset Camp you find yourself at an intersection.  To the
north and south you find two huts aligned equally.  To the west you find the
sun almost setting and to the east is where you came from.  Having trouble
making your decision on which path to pick you look up at the sun for some
advice.  It motions for you to continue your journey as your heart desires. 

<MAPEND>

Deeper into the Sunset Camp
  Getting deeper within the Sunset Camp, rows of huts and tents are built
neatly together.  This village seems too good to be true as you notice how
everyone here helps one another to build homes and gather supplies.  The
children play with each other, giggling at each others' jokes.  There are
warriors here and there to protect the villagers from any harm.  

<MAPEND>

n
Sunset Armor and Weapon Storage
  Arriving at the Blacksmith's shop, you can feel the heat against your
face as the blacksmith melts steel and shapes it into swords and axes.  The
sharp banging of hammer on hot steel tells you that the blacksmith is busy
making another weapon.  On the walls, weapons are hung up showing the
blacksmith's special skills in making weapons.  There is also a list of
prices for each of his weapons.  

<MAPEND>

(Red Aura) A Sunset blacksmith is here taking orders.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Entering the Sunset Camp
  You have arrived at Sunset Camp.  There are a few guards surveying the
entrance of the camp.  Right behind them, you see little huts filled with
villagers from old to young, walking around.  You believe you have chosen
the right path and hope the guards will not interfere with you getting into
the village.  The guards look mean, ready to strike at any time.  You gather
up all your courage and try to walk right past the guards, pretending to be
an ordinary villager in Sunset Camp.

Into the Sunset Camp
  Finding yourself inside the Sunset Camp, you find yourself gazing in
amazement.  The place looks like an undeveloped culture from the outside but
now you notice it isn't.  You start to jog your memory as you remember that
you have heard about this camp before.  Remembering that many years ago a
sandstorm hit the world and covered everything in miles of sand, you realize
that you have uncovered the last camp.

Following the Westward Path (2182)

Into the Sunset
  Still wandering in this wonderful camp, you find yourself at crossroads. 
A magical beam shining in the west begins to drag you in that direction.  As
you turn yourself east, you notice many priests holding hands and chanting. 
Putting your feet down, you stop the beam from taking you westward.  You
raise your hand to your chin and wonder which way to go.

Entering the Sunrise Camp

crowd you.  They push you around and inspect you closely.  You tell them you
mean no harm and they decide to let you pass.  You look around this camp and
have no idea what to call it.  Your face lights up as you think of the right
name... the Sunrise Camp.

the road.  You look around to figure out which way to go.  As you debate

A Sunrise
  Following the rays, you finally find yourself close enough to touch the
sun.  Enveloped by the beautiful yellow rays, you find yourself at peace. 
As you glare into the sun you feel your feet rising as a picture appears.  A
translucent ghost appears before you, begging you to do something, but you
cannot hear what he is saying.  Slowly floating back down to the ground as
the ghost fades away, you wonder what he said.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

little sandcastle for you and a few friends, perhaps?

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

On A Sandy Shore (G)
  You stand on a sandy shore, looking out at the endless sea.  Far into the
distance, the only thing you can pick out are choppy waves and an occasional
seagull.  Far down the coast, a village's small fishing fleet has just
pulled into the rude docks, or directly onto the sand.  A small group of
dolphins begins frolicking above the waves, spinning, leaping and
water-walking.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
(Golden Aura) A star shines in the night, perfect for wishing on.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3207/3698 HP  4349/4349 MP  2185/2191 mv  251tnl  
Lv 138  G 649057 | On A Sandy Shore (W)
>>
A falling star catches your eye.
The star gazes down at you with a clear gleam.
A star to wish upon asks, "Well, if you really want, though I don't see
 the attraction in the ocean, myself. Big, salty pond filled with filthy
 seaweed and slimy creatures.  Let's face it, who really wants to play with
 a jellyfish?"
The star shudders, and then grants your wish.
Under The Sea
  You watch the air bubbles rise as you swim under the sea.  Brightly
colored fish and other sea creatures dart past you, many of them seeming to
laugh at you.  The ocean floor is covered with sand, plants, and the
occasional rock or reef cluster.  A dim light comes down from above, letting
you see barely 20 feet ahead of you.

Under The Sea
  You find a deep crevasse that leads down farther under the waves.  A warm
current drifts up from the crack, and dim, eerie lights line the walls.  In
the far distance, down past where the sunlight pierces the water, you can
see a faint glow, as if from some incredibly bright light.

On A Royal Ship
  You stand on the deck of a royal ship.  Well-dressed, polite sailors move
about the ship, and nobles and courtiers all wander about, peering into the
water, fishing, or simply sitting and talking.  Purple banners flap from the
masts, and a light breeze blows the scent of salt water towards you.

Under The Sea
  Deep under the surface of the ocean, you find yourself within a huge
crevasse.  Odd, glowing fish flash past you, and you can see the bottom of
the ocean floor.  You suspect you are several miles beneath the sea.  In the
distance you can see a bright glow, illuminating a castle set into the rocks
of the seabed.

>>
In A Castle
  You swim within a huge, underwater castle.  Tall reef pillars twine to
the ceiling, colored brilliantly purple, orange, yellow, and blue. 
Brilliant fish swim past you, in and out of the castle, and the floor is
covered with pearls and golden coins.  The walls are mother-of-pearl,
gleaming brightly in the light from the glowfish.

Sea King's Throne Room
  You swim cautiously through this largely over-decorated room.  Heavy
tables of pearl and gold, and benches and tables of the same material, lie
strewn across the floor covered with gold.  Glowfish swim within the room,
lighting it as brightly as daylight, and a huge golden throne sits on one
end of the room.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Castle Gates
  Above you loom the great iron gates of Castle Caraway.  Threadbare
banners still snap and wave along the side of the gates, speaking of a
happier day for this benighted realm.  Peasants trudge along this road,
scattering when they see you.  You wonder what great catastrophe could have
struck to make such a peaceful realm into a warzone.  Suddenly, you are
almost run down by a troop of horsemen who are galloping madly away from the
castle.  One of them calls to you as he passes, "Flee, neighbor, while you
can!  A dragon has kidnapped the princess and would ravage all the land!"

A Long Hallway
  This is the west hall of Castle Caraway.  Torches in sconces line the
walls, casting a fitful light across the carpet.  The shadows reach up
across the ceiling, hiding any details from you, but you have the uneasy
feeling that something moved up there.  To the east lies the grand hall, and
there are closed doors to the north and south.

Sir Lauren's Room
  The room you have entered into reminds you of a prince's room.  Silk and
satin, all in shades of white and silver, cover practically every inch of
this bower of lordliness.  An armor stand rests in one corner, bare now of
the accouterments that once graced its form.  The bed is tastefully

carved delicately with scenes of unicorns and roses.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
